Reviews.Title: “conducive to a wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: mdherbs
Reviews.Content: The ammenities of this hotel are not only elegant but helped to make an easy and plaeasant stay for a senior citizen returning to Paris after being a student there 57years ago. It was first class all the way. A cheerful greeting everyday, a beautifully decorated room prepared upon arrival ealy in am,turn down with chocolate every night and written weather prediction for the following day. excellant service, abundant and delicious breakfast buffet. Everyone there was very professional,knowedgable and helpful in every way. Planned walking to desired locations for us and suggested local restaurants .For me it was the trip of a lifetime and although I have traveled to Europe many other times in my life , this was by far the best trip .The lavender bath every night was special to me.

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered gem”
Reviews.Author: Billymyb0y
Reviews.Content: Been back 3 times not and LOVE it.Montparnasse if that bit away from the centre and has a character of its own. The decor is immaculate and no matter how many guests, the material wallpaper means it it peaceful. The rooms are beautiful, very art deco. James Joyce and Katherine Mansfield stayed and wrote here among others. It's family owned still and the staff can't do enough to help. They provided late breakfast in room at no extra cost and generally went out of their way to assist. It's not a place for wild parties, but plenty of bars and restaurants a few minutes away. Victoria Palace is a 1930's style haven and far and away my favourite hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the plaque!”
Reviews.Author: Roy B
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for 4 nights,to attend the Ireland v France rugby international,On our first night we went for a meal in the latin quarter,arrived back at the hotel at 11.30 .As there was nobody at the bar we asked the night porter if we could have a night cap,he served us a gin and tonic and a whiskey and coke.(thirty euros twenty cents).During my 4 night stay,I only ever seen one other person at the bar.I wonder why.The next afternoon the housekeeper appeared in my room unannounced while I was watching tv,she apologised and left.A few minutes later I recieved a phone call from the manager advising me that this was a non smoking hotel,and a charge of 250 euros would be charged if we smoked in the room.I asked him why he was making this phone call and he advised me that his house keeper had smelt smoke in the room.I advised him that nobody had smoked in the room.I immediately went down to reception to confront the manager,once again I told him nobody had smoked in his room.I explained that 4 weeks previous I had been diagnosed with a lung condition that needed surgery and had immediately given up smoking.The last thing I needed was for a pretensious manager to complain about the smell of smoke in my room. My wife was totally incensed and wanted to leave the hotel,but unfortunately we had prepaid for our suite.The management of this hotel ruined our trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden GEM!!! Well worth the price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebArtist
Reviews.Content: AWESOME place! We LOVED staying here! Not much to look at from the outside, but everything inside was just wonderful! The staff was very personable. We had a king-bed junior suite. It was beautiful! Great space and very nice bathroom. There was no noise at night. We took a taxi to all the site we visited, and walked to restaurants that were close to the hotel. A very romantic place! Well worth the price! Check it out at www.victoriapalace.com

Reviews.Title: “all amenities, good location”
Reviews.Author: OrangeApple65
Reviews.Content: Close to 3 metro stops; good shopping; quiet; about one hundred euros cheaper than hotels nearer to the Seine. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel, location OK”
Reviews.Author: Travelin4Fun704
Reviews.Content: We took the kids over Thanksgiving and had a great stay at this hotel. We had two adjoining rooms. The location is not the best - its not like you can walk down the street and go to the Louvre but the staff makes up for it. They are great about getting you anywhere. Get the public transportation pass and you are good to go. We went on the metro, buses and the train to Versaille. The public transportation was clean and inexpensive. There are some good restaurants close by. Our facorite was a Steak Frites place two blocks away. We ate there 2 out of the 4 nights we were there. The staff can direct you there - you just tell them how you like your steak and go from there. Breakfast at the hotel was included in our rate - it was very good with plenty to chose from including delicious chocolate coissants and hot chocolate for the kids. Overall very nice hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedisney10
Reviews.Content: This was my first family trip to France. We still cannot stop talking about this hotel even months after the trip. This hotel is perfect. The quiet location cant be beat. I could go on and on. The breakfast was quite simply awesome. The staff here is so accommodating and nice. The rooms were large and clean. The bathroom was beautiful. The tolietries in the bathroom were top notch and the display was done so elegantly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tnrfe2009
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Paris where we stayed at the Victoria Palace hotel. I could say many things about the hotel, all of them probably said in previous critics: the rooms are big, comfortable, very clean, fantastic bathroom and amenities...and the hotel is just great. But I would like to say something more.- the staff at the hotel is incredible. They make you feel special. We were celebrating something very important, my parent's 50th wedding anniversary. Having read that the hotel had rooms with view to the street and view to a courtyard, I wrote a message to the hotel asking if it was possible to get a room with a nice view for my parents. Not only they got this, they were offered a bottle of champagne and we were upgraded to a junior suite. We had a bad experience on our way to Paris as we had an incident on the road and arrived late, cold after waiting 4 hours on the road, a bit upset....afraid the trip would be ruined. When we got to the hotel it was such a relief and bright thing to find the attentions that the manager had taken for us. From the deep of our hearts, THANKS. You made this trip a once in a lifetime experience. My little girl also got a nice present from the hotel, some toys and 2 books. What else can I say. This is a hotel with a "soul", not an impersonal one from the many hotel chains you can find in the city. The best experience we could have dreamed about. We hope one day we can return, this time, with better luck on the road. Greetings from spain.

Reviews.Title: “solid old-world”
Reviews.Author: taipeipeter
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said--great space for your bucks; good location Left Bank heart; convenient subways. Decent but not spectacular breakfast. Decor definitely old-style but nothing tattered about it. Basic internet is included & worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: piggy1102
Reviews.Content: Superb service from arrival to departure over 4 night stay. Great sized room ... Bathrobes, slippers. Lovely bathroom ... What we needed after hours of walking! Really clean and good location ... Having worked in 5 star hotels in London, this gets my seal of approval and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Latte50
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very helpful in answering all questions and providing recommendations. Milica at the front desk gave us restaurant recommendations that were always great and made reservations if we needed them. We found the location to be further from the Seine and sights on the Right Bank than we would have liked. The room was very comfortable, but the internet did not work in the room so we had to work on our laptop in the lobby or breakfast room. The breakfast buffet had a nice selection of cheese, meats, fruit, croissants and breads.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: pamlSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11 pm only to find that our agent had somehow sent through a request for a 2 person room instead of a mini suite for 3 people. The hotel was totally booked out but the Night Staff straight away organised and set up another rollout bed for us with the option of moving rooms the next morning. My daughters and I loved the decor of our room and the fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower so made the decision to stayput as the room was very roomy and we did not have a problem spreading out with our 3 large suitcases and 3 carry on suitcases. The bed and pillows were so so comfy. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with a good variety. The staff were very friendly, professional and helpful and really made our 4 night stay feel so special. Everyone from the staff on the Front Desk, breakfast staff and the bubbly and friendly barman/drink waiter helped to make our Paris holiday one to remember. Our Travel Agent recommended this hotel so many thanks Lara.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 169ustraveller169
Reviews.Content: We were originally given a room facing the interior courtyard, but really wanted a room facing the street; the staff was very accommodating and found us a beautiful junior suite. There are many lovely hotels to stay in when you visit Paris, but I don't think you'd find a better staff anywhere. Every single person - from the front desk to the breakfast staff - is knowledgeable, professional and very helpful. The bathroom was large and modern, although I did question it's cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Funky66
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by the travel agent we were using. We upgraded to the junior suite because it was important to us to have a nice size room with a sofa to sit on. Altho the deluxe suites would have probably been a fair size (we meant to view one but forgot), we were very happy with the size of the junior suite and felt like we had ample room to spread out and relax. The bed was very comfortable and let me tell you, this place knows what a good pillow is! Pillows are a big deal to us. After having come from Londond where we stayed at a bottom of the barrel Travelodge and were offered pancakes as pillows, it was a welcome treat to have perfectly plush pillows that weren't too high or too low. Very nice! The breakfast buffet was wonderful, and the coffee, oh my, the French know how to make coffee! Thoroughly enjoyed that every morning! It was nice to be able to have breakfast in the hotel as part of the daily price. This hotel is well located and yet tucked away on a side street away from the hustle and bustle. We took the Eurostar from London to Paris and were able to get off the Eurostar, transfer to the Paris metro and take that to within 2 blocks of our hotel and walk over, rather than pay for an expensive taxi ride. The metro system is wonderful and we used it a lot. There is also a Velib bicycle station right outside the hotel where you can rent bikes, which we did twice. Just be aware that your credit card will be charged 150 euros for each bike and will take up to two weeks to be adjusted to the actual charges for usage. The staff are very friendly and helpful and our experience was a very pleasant one. If we go back to Paris again, we will definitely stay here. No disappointments!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IdahoTimber
Reviews.Content: Although it is toward the south border of the 16th arr., this hotel is near subway and bus stops that make transit north quite easy. This is a lovely, well-run hotel with many junior suites that are of excellent size, and well- appointed, large and modern bathrooms. The staff is extremely well trained and professional. While no bargain, you should be very pleased with your stay at the Victoria Palace. Although it is on a small, narrow street, Paris is still a big city so ask for a room that looks into the courtyard to stay away from any street noise. There is a small grocery and convenience store on the corner for bottled water, toiletries or treats you may need during your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decently sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anna N
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here with our family in the days leading up to our French countryside wedding. We ended up staying here because the 3-star hotel that we had originally booked had a water leak and arranged for us to stay here for a few days while they fixed the leak. Victoria Palace was very conveniently located near Montparnasse. I have no idea how much our room would have cost us (we didn't have to pay the difference in cost) but the hotel staff was very helpful and overall, I would say that it was a 4-star experience. I also felt that the rooms were of a decent size for Paris standards. It was also a huge plus that our family had connecting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This should be a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: ash318
Reviews.Content: It was a 4 star,which is fine, but it was a little old looking from the outside, the internet didn't work well ( at all, though I was reassured they were getting fiber optics cable soon and within a month these issues will be resolved.). The rooms were very spacious but it was like being taken into the past, by around 20 years, wallpaper and sofa in matchiching print. The Jr. Suite that we stayed in, was very large and comfortable, it was a clean hotel, short walk (15 m) to St. Germain, renovated bathrooms but just not my kind of style. Continental buffet was good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Indeed a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chernichka
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in this hotel for three days now, and still have three to go. All the good reviews are true. This is really a very nice hotel, with very nice and helpful staff, which is rare in Paris, as I can see. our room is quite spacious. The bed is very, very comfortable - I sleep like baby - and that's a good point of having windows facing the inside of the hotel. The bathroom is big, with a bath and window. The location is comfortable too: close to Metro stations, and in a walking distance from the city center. We're here visiting the Expostion in Porte Verasille - and it's just 5-7 minutes by Metro. The only thing that could be better is wifi in rooms - slow, and you have to pay 25 Euros per 3 days. I would defenitely recomment this hotel, if you're in Paris for business or for a romantic trip. (But it's more romatic than businessy)

Reviews.Title: “perfect mother and daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: Joan W
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Paris with my daughter, I felt I had to review this wonderful hotel. The staff were great very helpful, the hotel is quiet and the room was perfect with a large bathroom. Very clean, would recommend this great little hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “sometimes you get more than you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: gary m
Reviews.Content: myself and partner have arrived back from Paris after a truly wonderful 3 days. The victoria palace is everything you need. On arrival, complimentry voucher for champagne. nice touch. shown to our Junior Suite, when we paid for a double deluxe- amazing. Room was spacious clean with tv dvd and cd player. desk. fab bathroom with amazing lighting. balcony sublime, quiet street. bathrobes, slippers , a turndown service, fresh tolietries twice a day, minibar, loads of towels, immaculate linen, amazing service, where nothing is too much trouble. professional staff are what they are. professional. they know how make your day without be too intrusive. always a smile. and always very curteous. The Owner and management should be proud of the standards that this hotel reaches. If your a couple celebrating something and want to do it in style, then treat yourself and stay in this fab hotel. go for a juniour suite and you wont regret. be quick though because this hotel is 51st best in paris at the moment on trip advisor but will be top ten in paris on trip advisor by end of year mark my words.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Palace: even better than before!”
Reviews.Author: JackmaryRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: We have returned to Victoria Palace in Paris after two years and, let 's say, it's excellent, even better than the first time! As we entered our room, there was a welcome letter, with chocolate bars, from the hotel staff, written in Portuguese, our country language! Very kind and moving! The room was elegant, clean and spacious, as usual. The reception staff , make the difference in this hotel. It's impossible to quote names cause all of them were nice. They were very polite, patient with our questions about where to go, where to find and restaurant reservations. So was, also, the attentive manager. The breakfast was fine, but some items could be replaced faster! And, last but not least, the mini bar now was super cold!!! Thank you for making our stay in Paris even better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: vigga
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and good location, I personally like the breakfast and my room was very nice, large and well decorated with the bed was excellent.The bathroom is absolutely amazing .The check in and check out was just a taste of unbelievable. Service and more service, luxury and style.The overall experience in the hotel was positive. All in all, we can't say enough great things about this property. We were constantly made to feel at home.. Cannot more highly recommend this hotel it was a fabulous experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: Hijjawi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between Montparnasse and St Germain, the hotel street is quite and nice, the staff are very helpful, i faced problem with my booking and it was solved in a short time, the hotel breakfast is average and basic for a 4 star hotel, i think they have to work more on their breakfast, plus there is no free Wifi metro stop is 1 min away from the hotel, Montparnasse station is 3-5 minutes walking from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional staff - very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Catherine70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of an offer they had - 1 free night in 3 - and all we can say is that it's SUPERB! The room had this luxury you can rarely find and the bathroom in pig marble called as for endless showers!! The location is great - in Montparnas area - and it's a place you remeber of for long time. We did not have breakfast so we can not tell.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back a third time”
Reviews.Author: MJLHoliday
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend, having visited at the same time last year and were looking forward to going back to the hotel again. We weren't disappointed and it was as good as we remembered. The reception staff were welcoming when we arrived mid-morning and set our expectations on when the room would be ready, i.e. the previous guests had gone, room not cleaned yet, but should be done in about an hour. We asked them to book a particular restaurant for us the following night and they made a note straight away. They were also ready to store our luggage and when we arrived back in the late afternoon, it had been taken up to our room. All the various reception staff were friendly, helpful and patient and appreciative of our attempts to practise our rusty French. The room was slightly smaller and darker than the one we had last year, being at the back rather than the front of the hotel, but it was still a good size and bigger than most Parisian rooms. The lighting was also very good with lights on the inside edge of the wardrobe doors, there was plenty of storage and at least 3 full length mirrors. We like the double doors between the corridor and the bedroom, so any corridor noise is minimised. The bathroom was spotless, with an endless supply of hot water, toiletries, towelling bath robes and slippers and the illuminated magnifying mirror helped with shaving and the application of make up. The bath is deep and there are plenty of soft white towels. The whole hotel was kept clean and tidy and there was an impressive display of fresh flowers in reception. Every time we walked in or out, the doorman leapt to open the inner door and to greet us. The breakfast room was very quiet, but as I am not a morning person that suited me. Service was quick and food was replenished without needing to ask for it. There was a good assortment of everything and the pastries were tasty, especially the pain au raisin. The bar is expensive, as other guests have commented, but it's to be expected in a central Paris hotel. After a hard day's walking, we enjoyed settling into the comfortable armchairs sipping excellent ice-cold gin and tonics and nibbling the accompanying crisps and nuts; David the barman was charming. If price is an issue, then there are plenty of bars in the vicinity and the one opposite serves a good beer. It doesn't seem, however, to be open on Sundays, so you might have to walk a few metres further. It's a good idea to take the reception staff's recommendation on restaurants. They ask what sort of place you are looking for and then advise what there is and book it for you if you wish. We ate at two good restaurants they suggested last year, both within 10 minutes walk and went back to one of them this year. There are hundreds of restaurants, brasseries, cafes and shops nearby, too many to mention, but there is a handy little coffee shop/patisserie (Brioche Doree) on the Rue de Rennes, on the right hand side as you walk towards the Montparnasse Tower. A stroll through the market on Edgar Quinet on a Saturday morning is a must and there is a good sized Monoprix supermarket on the Rue du Depart next to the Tower. It is only a very short metro journey from either St Placide or Montparnasse Bienvenue to get to any of the main tourist attractions. We will definitely be going back to the Victoria Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, helpful place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda61
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this lovely hotel. The staff was very helpful and polite. Our room was a mini-suite with a nice view of the street. The room was clean and neat and had all of the amenities. The staff was very helpful in selecting restaurants and making reservations for dinner and for tours. The bar and breakfast room were both lovely. It is English Victorian and anyone who wants a more French feel might be disappointed. We were not.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Palace is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADM1953
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Victoria Palace and it was excellent - great location, spacious rooms, helpful friendly staff. It is well located for shopping, restaurants or simply walking to places of interest. There are a number of Metro stations within easy walking distance, as well as one of the major Regional Stations ( we travelled to Bordeaux by train directly from there). It is also a short walk to the "Hop-On" bus. Plus, there's an excellent little bar directly opposite ! Victoria Palace is a great spot if you are staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JenV97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Victoria Palace for 4 nights in a Junior Suite, a very Parisian styled room, and loved it. It's in a great position to visit lots of places of interest, or just wander around the little streets nearby. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We would certainly be happy to return, and to recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home away from home in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboomer
Reviews.Content: Â  I wanted to take this opportunity to compliment the the fabulous members of staff at the Victoria palace. 1Â  the point of arrival,from the valet to the concierge staff was welcoming,friendly professional..during our entire stay the team went out of their way to assist with transportation,restaurants,tickets to points of interest etc. Â  2Â  the entire team concierge,restaurant the bar staff,room attendantsâ€¦these are individuals that are exceptionally well trainedâ€¦they provide a level of service with kindness and from my observations they seem to provide that level of consistent service to every other guest. Please express our comments to your staff..we intend to recommend the Victoria palace to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and Warmth”
Reviews.Author: duncan14
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. The staff met our expectations, greeted us by name and anticipated our every need. The hotel perfectly combines old world charm and old fashioned elegance with modern convenience. I know we will return to this gem next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located, but horrendously expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Rockyroad2dublin
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were unlucky, being charged the rack rate for new year, because other than that this is an ok hotel. Fairly well located, close to metro stations etc. Five minute walk from a number of restaurants on Bvd Montparnasse, and within a 15 minute walk of the left bank restaurant area. The room was a "junior suite", effectively a longish attic room with a bathroom at one end and a wc at the other, sloping ceilings in part. Decor was very French, fabric covered walls etc. Breakfast was buffet style and was well presented, if somewhat limited for a hotel in this price range. Bar prices are also very expensive and the bar should be avoided at all costs; the bill for a brandy and a soft drink was almost 30 euro! In short, this hotel is probably ok if you get a good rate (and avoid the bar), but at anything above 100 euro it is best given a miss. The Hotel Ampere (avenue de Villiers) is a better hotel for instance, and tends to be a lot cheaper, and I'm sure that there are many other examples of better value out there. I found no real fault with the service in this hotel, but at more than 700 euro for two night's bed and breakfast, I wouldn't go back. Paris does tend to have a "rip-off" culture, and this is just another example of it. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “if you have a baby stay here”
Reviews.Author: marcork2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and 8 month old baby stayed here. Staff very friendly. Rooms great size. Plenty of room for cot bed and baby to crawl around. Supply highchairs - good breakfast. fruit, yoghurts and toast for baby. Location - good for walking. It is about a 15 minute walk to jardin du luxembourg

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - lots of places to eat & shop. Near a metro station and bus”
Reviews.Author: AkshayMaheshwary
Reviews.Content: Place was average but location was brilliant. Internet was slightly slow. Rooms were neat and clean and service was as expected. Break fast was decent. Rooms were a bit gloomy but it was a 3 min walk to a metro and bus stop. One of the largest malls in Paris was close by. Lots and lots of places to eat close by. Useful place for a 1st time visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Cali_girl010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite for a week, found it to be very roomy and comfortable, large for a European hotel. The staff was very professional and helpful, with personalized maps to specific locations and excellent restaurant suggestions. The breakfast is very good with lots of choices, items replenished frequently. While tucked away in a little corner, the hotel is very quiet, beds are excellent and comfort for a traveler couldn't be better. Good access to transportation and shops.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: 41kailua
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good qualities. The good size room had French print fabric wallcoverings and drapes. The marble bathroom had been recently renovated. The exterior facade of the hotel needs an upgrade and some paint, and it is located on an unattractive street a little too far from the heart of Paris. The lobby and bar are attractive. The breakfasts are plentiful, but to have a mediocre croissant in Paris is a shame, and the eggs tasted powdered. Some of the front desk staff should be more friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinanina
Reviews.Content: This is a little charming hotel with all the conditions you could wish for, including extremely friendly staff. We stayed in a suite and it was a great stay, our son was treated with extreme friendliness at all times. Breakfast is excellent. The location, however, could be better. Although central, it is on a hidden back street with not much to see or do (no restaurants or shops close by). We found the room to be in excellent condition and the hotel to be extremely confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience - we will stay there again when we return to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: dtsbaker
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed for three nights in a junior suite at the hotel in late October 2010. We were very happy with the overall experience. Our room was ready early for us when we arrived and it was very clean and comfortable. The whole hotel was also very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was also very good. The hotel staff was very helpful whenever we had a request or a question. They even tracked down my daughter's missing camera when she left it on a tour bus. We all thought the location was quite convenient for visiting different sites around Paris. The hotel is located on a quite side street so there was no issue with any noise either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, lovely quiet rooms only a block off a main boulevard, professional staff,”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkcitygirl13
Reviews.Content: Second stay here 6 nights this time, ten the last We wouldn't stay anywhere else! We take a junior suite to have a little more room and find that very spacious. A foyer with closets puts a second door between the sleeping area and hallway noise, and the double glazed windows, heavy drapes and great bed make for a really good night's sleep. Not cheap but it's Paris and you get really good value for the investment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdxbrophym
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel on two occassions in September. The rooms were charming, quiet and quite large for Paris standards. The staff was professional and extremely helpful with their recommendations. The location is perfect. The breakfast is delicious too. Will stay here again when we make a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler071
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this beautiful hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. We had a junior suite and truly felt pampered. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, quiet, and lovely, the location was perfect. We will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: TanyaTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is a 1/2 hour walk to wither the Louvre or the Eiffel Tour. The bus system and metro are also very close. It is off the main roads which makes the hotel very quiet. The rooms are very old European in style which makes them very dark. The beds are very hard and not very comfortable. The staff were very courteous and friendly. The restaurant is very good and their is a bar acroos the road from the hotel. The mainstreet offers a variety of shopping and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: alihuen
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, and with attentive staff. Situated in Montparnasse. Public transportation - bus and metro - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel -- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jrpmak
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed two stays at this fabulous property during July. When we arrived first at the hotel following our flight from the US, our two-bedroom suite was not yet ready but the concierge offered us the use of the hotel's meeting room to change and organize our belongings. The hotel recommended a fabulous brassiere within easy walking distance for lunch. Upon our return from lunch, our rooms were ready and the concierge had prepared gifts for each of our children including cones containing a variety of games and other goodies and French-language books. Our rooms were spacious, clean and extremely quiet. The two bedrooms were divided by a good-sized sitting room which was perfect for when we ordered room service for the kids. The bathrooms were quite large and equipped with everything one needed. The air condition worked perfectly in our three rooms, and often we found the need to adjust the ac because the rooms became too cold. Location of the hotel is perfect. You can walk to the Sienne, the fabulous Jardin de Luxembourg, or enjoy one of the many cafes on Montparnasse for great people watching. At night, you can see the Eiffel Tower in all its glory from one of the many cafes on Montparnasse. Or, if you prefer, you can catch the metro or the bus to the Eiffel Tower, or the bus to the Louvre. The staff were extremely responsive and arranged a fabulous birthday celebration for one of our sons at a fantastic restaurant nearby. We did not experience the "lack of warmth" described in one of the earlier posts. We would not hesitate to stay at this lovely hotel again and will recommend it to all our friends planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Maddenmd
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is a hidden gem. The rooms were nicely sized for Paris. We had two rooms- one with a large bath and one with a smaller one. They were behind a third door that we could lock to have our own corridor. Each room was private, but we could leave the doors unlocked in that corridor and go from room to room to say goodnight, or wake up the kids in the morning. It was an ideal set up for a family with teens. From their location, you can easily walk to almost every part of Paris. It is also very close to a metro stop. The breakfast in the morning which is included in the room rate had great variety (hot foods such as eggs, cold dishes such as meats and cheeses, multiple kinds of breads, croissants, juices, fruits). Another poster described how only one computer could be used at time- and that was a negative. However, we had no difficulty with skype- used it daily, and the converters were lent to us free of charge. They took a deposit which they refunded when you returned the converters. The front desk staff were polite, but not friendly. This lack of warmth accounts for the 4 star rating. We would however stay here again the next time we visit Paris. It is a hidden gem, on a quiet street, with air conditioning!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: maerlyn8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two weeks in London and Paris and spent 5 days in the Victoria Palace. We could not have enjoyed ourselves more! The room was beautiful, the bathroom was spacious, the balcony was marvelous (so Parisian) with great views, and the price was right! The hotel is very clean, and the staff is great. There is a hotel bar that many of the guests spent a nice evening in, talking and sharing stories. David, the bartender, was the best!!! Even the room service was delicious - some of the best food we had. The breakfast was quite extensive, as well. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Paris and does not want to be in the heart of tourist territory. From the hotel you can walk to pretty much any location, but you are far enough into the heart of the city to not be plagued by mobs of tourists! While the hotel doesn't have every amenity going, it is simple and relaxing while also having a touch of elegance and opulence; it's just what a place in Paris should be. Also, I want to mention that everybody there spoke English and were nothing but nice and helpful! Oh, and for you summer travelers, there is AC (a rarity in Europe). We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel With Gracious Staff But Limited Internet Access”
Reviews.Author: seotraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel located in a great place to walk to hundreds of restaurants, pubs and shops. The hotel staff were very nice and the rooms were very clean. We had a Junior Suite which had a queen size bed and room for a fold out bed for our 13 year old son. The hotel is quiet, and the bathrooms were spacious. The soaking tub was full-sized and comfortable. The pillows are a bit skimpy so if you love a full sized fully pillow, bring one along. The front desk staff were very accomodating and spoke fluent English. The hotel charged 15 Euros for a USA power chord converter so you should bring your own and save some money. As a business traveler, the Internet is painful. Your 10 Euro a day fee does not allow two wireless connections at the same time so I could not work while my son was on his computer. The hotel also blocks Skype and IP phone traffic so this is one reason why I would not stay here again. Since I work while away and check email and call the US often, the hotel's Internet policy is restrictive and outdated. Internet speeds were good for email but not for video. So for the 10 Euro a day fee, this is no bargain. If you don't care about the Internet, this is a very nice place to stay. If you need the Internet, look for another hotel that has Internet include and that does not block Skype. The hotel does not have a gym but for 25 Euros a Day (ouch) you can use the gym across the street. If you get the theme, everything is an upcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: jeffkristy1
Reviews.Content: Quiet little hotel right in the middle of everything. Easy walking distance to the metro & bus routes, great resteraunts, shopping, & sight seeing. A real Parisian feel with very nice rooms and amenities. Would definetly recommend this one to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - good with details”
Reviews.Author: Moffedillen
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in the stylish lobby, we felt very welcome. The room was amazing and spacious, and we were very impressed with the small details they provided that made our day a little more enjoyable. Like the chocolate on the pillow, the coming days weather report, and the info leaflets. Good location near Montparnasse Tower and St.Germain trainstation. Most recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: claudio756
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Victoria Palace. How anyone can find something wrong with this hotel is beyond me. Jr. Suite room is spacious, clean and comfortable. Front desk is great from Nicholas, Mark and especially Sebastian. Great value in a good location in Paris with excellent restaurants within walking distance and three easily accessible metro stops close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Four Star Find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Betera
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a wonderful stay at the Victoria Palace Hotel in Paris. We found a terrific price via Orbitz--quite a bargain. The hotel is beautifully decorated and maintained. Our room (the biggest I've ever had in Paris) had an entry hall leading to a very large bedroom/sitting room, with two floor to ceiling glass doors leading to two separate balconies. The views of the city were lovely. Attractive wallpaper, matching draperies, turn down service with chocolates on the bed added to the charm. The breakfast was varied and tasty and served with warmth by a lovely staff. The front desk (each and every person) could not have been more helpful. One concierge in particular, Michael, gave excellent suggestions, explained transportation options in detail, drew maps for us and made sure we were well taken care of. From the clean and well maintained rooms and hallways, to the inviting sitting rooms,this was a beautiful hotel. When you add the warmth and professionalism of the staff, you have an unbeatable combination. I appreciate the reviews of others on Trip Advisor, which helped me choose this property, and I heartily recommend it to others. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skully99
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Paris and had a fabulous time. We try to travel abroad a few times a year and so we are always looking for a "good Deal". This certainly was one. This hotel is central but not in the most expensive areas of Paris so you can eat out every night easily. We walked to the Louvre, The Eiffel tower, The luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame St Germain's Chapel easily from the Hotel, you could also have got the Metro if you weren't fond of Walking but Paris is so pretty its a shame to travel underground and there can be some " unusual characters on the Metro!! The Breakfast was quite good I'm from Ireland so it wasn't quite the same as the " Full Irish " you get back home, but it was more than ample with good choice for even the most picky eater ( as I am one. ) Our room was on the second floor and extremely quite, we felt like we were the only ones in the hotel until we went to Breakfast and found some fellow guests!! The bedroom was like an Apartment with a separate toilet and storage room. Everything was extremely clean. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, how gorgeous and special”
Reviews.Author: Stylegirl35
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I were having the trip of a lifetime to Paris. We stayed five nights in a self-contained apartment on the other side of the Seine, and our last two at the Victoria Palace Hotel in a Junior Suite. The apartment was great - nice and central but when we got to the Victoria Palace - wow. What a gorgeous hotel - we felt so very spoiled. The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, I can't say any more than we just felt "looked after". Perhaps I hadn't realised that staying in the apartment had had it's own stresses? Our room overlooked the courtyard and as such was impressively quiet, the small entrance foyer to the room itself added to the peace - we never heard a sound while ensconsed in incredibly comfortable surroundings. Gorgeous marble bathroom, great space: even with three women with shopping bags and suitcases! Each morning we enjoyed an excellent and delicious breakfast buffet. Add all of that to the easy walking distance to two metro stations, close to several good food options but tucked away enough to avoid traffic noise - what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place with great service”
Reviews.Author: LondonJackattack
Reviews.Content: I took my new partner to Paris for Valentines Weekend (2010) and we stayed at VP in a Junior Suite. The staff could not do enough for us, and the room was great. I thought all in all it was good value for money, and would definitely stay there again. Just to give a feel for the basis for this review I am a professional male who lives in London and travels regularly. I can take the rough with the smooth and have stayed at the worst motels in the world, and also stayed in suites at the Waldorf Towers - so I guess I know my onions). Downsides: It could maybe be 5 mins closer to the centre of town if I was being REALLY picky, but it was not an issue for us as Paris is so easy and small to walk around. It also does not look like it is on the best street in the world, but this made no difference and actually enhanced the experience as it was quieter! There was also a lack of atmosphere in the bar area? These are harsh criticisms though for the discerning traveller - its a cracking little hotel, and the area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pointy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December, had a lovely time, hotel spotlessly clean, big room with a balcony looking out onto the street, in an ideal location, just off rue de rennes and a few minutes walk to the nearest metro. Loads of restaurants nearby and plenty shops for a spot of retail therapy. Hotel was quiet as in we met no other quests but saying that we were gone all day sightseeing and only came back to shower and change and go out to dinner. We had a drink one night in the bar and it was very expensive. We booked this hotel online and got a great rate would have been expensive to stay there otherwise. Other than that would def recommend this hotel for a very enjoyable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkChubby
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 times in the past. Enjoy the parisian feel of the rooms and common rooms. Needed to change our room location as it was in the front of the hotel near the elevator. I am a really light sleeper and the noise would have been a problem. Sebastian gave us excellent service and changed our room immediately. Enjoyed the breakfast which was included in our room rate. Will always have fond memories of the VP

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Martin017
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights in Paris over New Year and had a great time. This hotel is an absolute gem, spacious, clean and charming rooms. Great location, near the bus and metro service. Within walking distance of the Eiffel tower, Louvre, etc. The staff is very friendly and always have some advise about shopping or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem in St-Germain des Pres / Montparnasse area”
Reviews.Author: DEBUOSHOU
Reviews.Content: You may feel little uncertain about your selection when you arrive at the entrance by the alley. However, such impression will be disappeared very soon when you step forward to the lobby & your room!! "Yes, this is a 4 star hotel." We selected this hotel from the list offered by our travel agency considering the score in Tripadvisor, price and its location. We were definitely right about our decision! Our bedroom/bathroom at 6th floor was roomier than expected for 3 persons incl. a girl. The room had a deck to breath fresh winter air whenever we needed. Daily room cleaning seemed to be perfect but sometimes they forgot to put our bathrobes. This was only one small defect but they carried them when they came to bring chocolates at night. You will be satisfied with rich-taste "kusmi" brand tea, derived from Russian tea, and delicious Camembert cheese is served at breakfast. Rennes street was very crowded. You will never feel lonely. The hotel was so close to Saint Germain shopping area. Only 20m to FNAC & Zara, 120m from H&M, 6 min. to Sadaharu Aoki & Monoprix supermarket, 8 min. to Le Bom Marche,12 min from J.M.Weston. 14 min. Many cafe/restaurant near Vavin station (6-7 min.) open on Sunday. Not only traditional French dishes including crape but also Thai, Indian, Chinese, Lebanese restaurants are available in the area around the hotel. Many bistros on Rue du Cherche Midi were so interested but many closed due to Christmas. We did not use Metro but took the public bus at "Rennes-Littre" stop or "Rennes-St.Placide"stop. The hotel will provide brief guidance with a copy. Bus No.95 direct to Louvre/Opera/Vanves Flea Market, No.96 direct to Marais district/Vosges Park was very convenient. No.82 direct to Tour Eiffel also useful. I bought "carne (discount coupon for 10 times)" at Montparnasse Station (6-7 min.) & St.Placide station (3 min.) when I went for a walk early in the morning. At last, we have to say thanks to Mr. bellboy from Sri Lanka who was kind enough for us all the time we met! Thanks a lot! I will stay here again when I visit Paris next!!

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond my expectations. Just like a country house”
Reviews.Author: exantheim
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel as part of a package. The staff is so polite they stand when you enter the lobby. The lobby is sumptuous and my room looked like a picture from a magazine -- french furniture, marble topped dresser, fabric covered walls, a huge marble bath. The buffet breakfast is excellent -- lots of fresh fruit, the best bacon I ever ate, etc. The regular price of my room with breakfast was over $500, but I paid only half. I'm a bit of a cheapskate so I would never have chosen so elegant a place myself. But staying here made me very happy, and I'm going to return as soon as I can. I was a bit nervous about the location, but the hotel is just a few hundred feet from the rue des Rennes, where there are major bus lines going to the museums and shopping. The metro is about a four minute walk away. There's a grocery store on the corner of rue Vaugirard, and a huge FNAC (look at their book department please) on the corner of des Rennes. The railroad station Gare Montparnasse is a 5 minute (you have to cross a huge intersection) walk away. For those of you who need a very fast meal, there's a McDonald on des Rennes just three minutes away. (I ate there once when I was too tired to go looking for a restaurant, and the food is of a high quality we need to copy in the USA.) The Blvd just north of the hotel, is lined with eateries of all qualities. I would certainly recommend this hotel and thank the owner and staff for making my stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: EfrainA
Reviews.Content: Very french style nice attention, although rooms were little they made you feel cozy, besides is very close by to great stores at rue de rennes and montparnasse, located in the exclusive 6th zone was very secure and easy to get everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: svengorgirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Victoria Palace Hotel on the 4th November 2009 for 3 nights to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival our case was swiftly taken by Sebastian and we were warmly welcomed (in English by the way). I had previously e-mailed the Hotel to ask if they could book a table at 58 Tour Eiffel for an anniversary meal and if they would try to arrange a room with nice views to make our stay something to remember. All this was done and confirmed by return e-mail. At reception we were given a handwritten note from Sebastian (very good English) confirming the details of the restaurant booking and another envelope containing a voucher for 2 glasses of Champagne at the bar to celebrate our anniversary! Staff very pleasant and welcoming at breakfast also. Breakfast is self service, which we prefer and there was plenty to choose from - orange juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, fresh fruit salad, cereals, yoghurt, various breads, croissants etc., cheese, ham and also hard-boiled or scambled eggs, sausage and bacon for those wanting something hot - more than sufficient. Room needless to say was fantastic. We were on the 7th floor, 2 balconies, marble bathroom, beautiful toileties, fluffy towels etc., and all importantly, nice view. Think you can pay for a turndown service in the evenings, however we didn't bother - as it turned out they did this for us anyhow on our last evening leaving a little note of the following day's weather and a couple of chocolates. Very nice touch. An example of the excellent attention to detail and friendly nature of the hotel. Excellent supply of information booklets in the lobby and given to us upon arrival (inc. tourist map of the city and shops in the locality including all the nearby chocolate shops!) The hote is situate in a quiet side street but surrounded by a multitude of shops, patisseries, restaurtants etc., (and Macdonalds which my husband thought was fantastic!) The Hotel is situate between Metro Saint Placide and Gare Montparnasse, both easy to navigate through and really once you've reached the metro you can get anywhere within 5 to 10 mins. Already recommended this hotel to friends travelling next year - just wish we were going back too!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian”
Reviews.Author: erinnicolemick
Reviews.Content: Very "Paris". The whole hotel looks like it was from the victorian era. It is small, but very quiet. The staff speaks english well, and are very friendly. Everyone smiled a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay In Paris...You Won't Be Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LOVETOTRAVELLVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Palace for about a week. It is located on a quiet street tucked away from the hustle and noise of the main streets of Paris. The hotel only has 66 rooms which makes your stay less rushed. Fewer people mean more attention to each guest which is exactly what you receive during your stay. The staff spoke English beautifully, the breakfast was delicious and the rooms were all that we expected. Bathrooms are marble and stocked with first class toilet articles, plush towels and bathrobes and slippers. Turndown service is provided nightly. I would highly recommend this hotel for its cleanliness, service, value, location and pleasure of the stay. Everyone from the front desk staff to the servers in the dining room were all friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs. We were welcomed back each afternoon after our tours and greeted by friendly and inviting faces. If you want to be within walking distance of some of the major attractions, this is probably not the hotel for you. The major attractions are close, but probably not close enough to walk to them unless you are used to walking long distances. The hotel is located in one of the better neighboorhoods of Paris and we enjoyed being with the local people. If you need tours while in Paris, I would highly recommend ParisPrivate Guide.com. Work with Christopher. We had 2 people in wheelchairs and were able to access all the major attractions without a problem. For the dinner crusie on the Seine, stay away from the everyday lines (too many people...very poor quality boats) and go with Yachts de Paris @ www.yachtsdeparis.fr. They are pricey; however, you have dinner on what is essentially a private yacht that holds no more than 50 people. The service is outstanding and you have almost one server per table. The entire evening is elegant with food prepared by on onboard chef and a cruise on a restored yacht....WELL worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “FEELING LIKE ROYALTY”
Reviews.Author: giladltd
Reviews.Content: When we searched for a hotel in the area of st. germain it was a difficult task. at the end we decided to gamble on Victoria. why a gamble ? because the web site was not appealing. We were expecting an old hotel....Instaed it was one of the most enchanting places to be. We felt like royalty. beacause of the room. because of the decoration. because of the location. and absolutly because of the service we received from the hotel's personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenfromca
Reviews.Content: Charming is the word that comes to mind when describing this hotel. The rooms are spacious, which we were not expecting. We had 2 balconies, which were great. There was turn down service with chocolates. The rooms were clean and well appointed. I suppose one could say that the wallpaper was overdone, but we thought it was charming. The breakfasts they had were awesome! The scambled eggs were the best I have ever had and the bread, of course, was supurb. The location was great. We were only 3 blocks from the Metro, had a small grocery store on the corner and close walking distance to cafes, bistros, restaurants and shopping. There was even one right across the street, which we never did try. Those things said, there were some negatives about this hotel. Some of the staff had very bad body oder. There was no free wi fi, though they did have 1 computer in the lobby available , though the wi fi was still not free. They didn't know very much about the gym the hotel was assocatied with. The area where they served breakfast was not used during the rest of the day as a restaurant. Even with those negatives, I would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend people to stay there. The hotel was delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service and excellent bar!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Geoff
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised by Victoria Palace! Not only was the staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, the room (and bathroom) were huge by Paris standards! I have to disagree with another post on the hotelâ€™s location. For us the location was ideal. We are in our mid-40â€™s and donâ€™t mind walking and taking the metro to get around. Located in the sixth, it is close to the metro and lots of great shops and cafes. Next time we are in Paris, we will definitely stay at Victoria Palace once again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for "a girl's" trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Novedc
Reviews.Content: Three generations of women including an 11 year old came to Paris to explore the city. This hotel was very pretty. The room was large enough for 3 with a roll in bed. The bath was marble, modern, clean and spacious. The staff was very friendly, service was great, and the breakfast buffet was very good! English is spoken here. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: JackBAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with friends to Provence and capped our vacation with five days in Paris. We always rely on trip advisor to help us decide among hotels that we have found based on research and friends' recommendations. We had some doubts about the Victoria Palace's general location mentioned by several reviewers but thought that the attributes they wrote about would outweigh the slightly offbeat locale. We absolutely love Paris not least because of its beauty and interesting street life. The immediate area (several block radius) of the V-P is among the least attractive and least interesting we have experienced. A good paint job and new signage on the adjacent hotel garage would help to mitigate that feeling. The overall location, while not the best, is ok in terms of accessibility to transportation and attractions. Our room at the V-P was good sized and the bathroom big and beautiful. There was more than ample storage. We faced the courtyard--quiet but not providing a lot of brightness. The decor while somewhat "over the top" is well done and we found it attractive and pleasing. Our friends were in a junior suite and it was quite lovely and very large. The staff is what makes the Victoria Palace special. The concierge-front desk people, especially Sebastian, were truly exceptional--always cheerful, spoke great English, thus compensating beautifully for my halting French, and helpful in fulfilling requests major and minor. The entire staff (with the exception of the breakfast room wait staff) were friendly, beautifully trained and anxious to make the extra effort to ensure that the guests' stay at their hotel is a great one. The breakfasts (included in our web-found deal) were very good and plentiful by French standards--variety of rolls, breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt and and scrambled and boiled eggs. There is no restaurant in the hotel but our friends had an excellent experience with a room service dinner one evening. Once through the front door we really liked the Victoria Palace, but I can't get past the neighborhood's lack of charm and, for the first time ever, staying in a Parisian hotel where we were not surrounded by beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ricsf
Reviews.Content: We spent a perfect four nights in Paris. The Palace Hotel staff the bartender David and the location were simply charming and warm and friendly in every way. We felt welcome and enjoyed every moment in Paris. The room was too good to be true. If you want to stay in a great area that is convenient but quiet clean and with great restaurants nearby pick this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with Parisian flair”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel for a short weekend trip to Paris with family. I thought the rooms were charrming and large by Paris standards. The bar and lounge area is delightful -- a crazy feast for the eyes! And, the service was very attentive -- we got several terrific restaurant recomendations from the staff and thought they were knowledgable and helpful. I have stayed in several different parts of Paris, and would say that this location was not great for the activities we had planned. But, the staff and the charm of the hotel made up for the extra distance to the placess we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to say anywhere else in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Mosyzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week in Paris. This was our 1st trip together to Europe. I did a lot of homework before I finally booked this hotel. For a 4 star hotel, their price is reasonable with breakfast included, and we were very impressed by the endless good reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 6th floor (non-suite) for the week. We had 2 huge beautiful balconies outside our room, and had the view of a nice Parisian neighborhood that took my breath away the moment I stepped in the room. Our bathroom was all marble, very, very roomy and bright for a city hotel. The sheets and towels were always clean and fresh, It truly felt like home in this place and we very much looked forward to "going home" to rest after a whole day of busy sightseeing in Paris!! The other wonderful thing about this hotel is that it's only less than 2 minutes walk to the Metro, where you can take a direct train to the Paris Nord train station for intercity and international travel, as well as most of the sights in Paris. We were able to catch a train @ 6:13 in the morning to Amsterdam by taking the metro!! The hotel is surrounded by boutiques, shops, cafes and restaurants. It's in a semi traditional Parisian neighborhood, so you may walk into a restaurant with zero English on the menu like what happened to us on our 1st day!!! But it was such a wonderful experience, and we walked out the restaurant with full tummies and smiles. All of the hotel staff we spoke with spoke very good English, and were very nice. So if you don't know any French like my husband and I, this is a great hotel to stay and make yourself comfortable. My husband and I have traveled in many cities in the Americas and Asia together before this trip to Europe. Out of all the 4 and 5 star hotels weâ€™ve stayed in, I have to admit that VP is one of our favorites. VP really surprised us because most of our friends told us that a 4 star hotel in Europe is like a 3 star hotel in the US in terms of the cleanliness and space, and a lot of the pictures of the Paris 4 star hotels I saw online before my trip looked like dirty motels!!! VP made our Paris trip truly special!

Reviews.Title: “Had to run away from Victoria Palace, literally”
Reviews.Author: Missika
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel for its 4 star rating and excellent reviews on Tripadvisor(I have found many great hotels with tripadvisor)with the very low promotional room rate offered by a hotel discounter. I expected a classy boutique type hotel, but instead arrived to a Parisian version of a Holiday Inn Express with bright wall paper. It was very empty(surprising for the high rating-25-50% capacity?) and the few guests were mostly US or UK liesure travellers. While it was clean, quiet(it was almost empty), and had a good breakfast, the negatives were overwhelming. 1) The beds are poor, hostel to 2 star quality. I think the homeless man living on a front porch of a vacant building on Vaugiraurd(close to hotel) had a better bed. I can say this, becuase he was often entertaining guests as we walked by and they looked comfortable. 2) location- its got a 6thA address, but its really far from tourist sights 3) The toilet is located at the front of the hotel room, away from the nice bath and sink in the back(They leave a Charmin wipe packet on the floor to make up for a sink) The safe too is located in this front area. This is an issue becuase the door that seals off the toilet/safe area from the room makes this area vunerable to abrupt walkins by hotel staff. On 4 occasions(various vague reasons or to ask for a linen turndown) that we know of, staff walked in because we couldnt hear the knock because the 2nd door. The one time I did hear the 'knock' , it was faint at best. I think they shouldnt enter when the shower is running, and you could hear that from the hallway. This is creepy because you can be caught with your pants down or safe open while showering. The last 2 days we kept the do not distrub sign out and locked the door always. 4) Taxi service called by hotel- We planned to take a taxi and relax on our way to the airport. Upon checkout they called a local cab. The taxi promptly broke down in front of the hotel after we got in. After 5-10 minutes of trying to start the car, he put the hazards on and left the cab blocking the 1 way st. After cars honking, I had to push it out of the way so traffic could pass as hotel employees just watched. I asked for another cab, but none came. They let the 1st cabbie call his friend to jump him. This other cab had jumper cables, was 20 min away but started his meter when he was called(there is a taxi stand 1 minute away and VP allows this?) By this time, Im going to be late if I make it at all & a 100E cab fare for the pleasure because he wont go to the airport until they fix the first cab(meter running of course)- What a joke! Still zero help from Victoria Palace. At that time we ran to the metro(the blue line has a 25 minute ride to CDG where cabs need an hour) and made it to CDG in the nick of time- but we could have hurt ourselves running with luggage. Btw- as we left the cab, the cabbie that couldnt speak English laughed and said something like 'OK, go but I thought you needed to get to the airport'' in reasonable english. This is a 3 star hotel if they get new beds and helped their patrons when they needed it. As it is, there is no way I can recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Not a 4-Star Property”
Reviews.Author: nteam_newyork
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with this place!! Our travel agent offered it and we selected it in part because of all the positive reviews we read here. I guess the hotel gets their 4-stars for the little polyester slippers, the plazma TV and their bathroom products - all things that we would have happily exchanged for some real service and amenities. The hotel bedding is standard US Army issue: cheap, worn sheets and blankets, and paper thin pillows. The decor is supposed to be Old Paris, but in reality it is just old and in dire need of updating. We had to change three rooms and finally pay a 50E/per day upgrade to get a room with a mold-free, updated bathroom and sufficient light. Though breakfast was included in our rate, we decided to eat elsewhere after we noticed that the breakfast dishes were not clean. Every juice glass we picked up had lipstick marks and we were served coffee in a cup sporting a hair and unidentified, sticky stuff! As you can imagine, we brought all of this to the attention of the hotel staff. No one cared! The hotel's response: go elsewhere since you clearly don't like it here. This was what we heard from the desk clerk, but more importantly, also from Mr. Philippe Venet, the hotel manager personally. This hotel is not a 4-star property by any stretch of imagination and the management does not care about improving it. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: cbjim
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel only because I wanted a place within walking distance to Gare Montparnasse, but it was so much better than just a convenient place to stay before catching a train. The staff was very welcoming, friendly, & helpful and their English was excellent. The Deluxe Room was spacious, clean and best of all, an excellent value. I have paid twice the amount that I paid here for a room in several hotels nearer to the Boulevard Saint-Germain and received a lesser room and lesser service. I would stay here again even if I didnâ€™t need to use Gare Montparnasse. It would be worth walking a little further to visit the sights I like to see along the river.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 stars hotel with a 5 stars service, we were delighted”
Reviews.Author: coockie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night in the Victoria Palace for a weekend brake. The VP is very conveniently located, close to St Placide metro station, in a small side street off one of the major boulevards on the south bank, some 20 minutes walking distance from the Seine river. We can only recommend this hotel and it will definitely become our new nest when we go to Paris: kind and efficient staff everywhere, cosy and comfortable rooms, large enough and with a genuine "belle epoque" feel, without being "baroque", good large bed with hard mattress, decent bathroom with ample amenities and towels. Nothing is too much asked for the staff and the hotel has a real "feel at home" feeling. Due to its location, the hotel is also very quiet, so no noise nuisance not during the day nor the night. Large breakfasts with large choice of just about anything. We didn't try the bar, but it looked very cosy as well. Loads of nice restaurants, bars and brasseries in the area. The hotel has 4-stars, but as far as attitude and service is concerned, deserves 5. All comments about the VP in tripadvisor just confirm our experience as well, and we will not hesitate a second to go back

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Patti2
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights at Victoria Palace for our 30th Anniversary. What a gem. Service is spectacular and location fabulous. There is nothing I would change. The room (standard) and marble bathroom were huge compared to other hotels in Paris. Incredible staff - they all go out of their way to help. They suggested great restaurants, sights, and helped everyday with directions. We will definitely return and recommend this marvelous hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: Amy3376
Reviews.Content: Myself and my parents travelled to Paris and spent 5 nights at the Victoria Palace. On arrival, we were informed that since we were three adults, they thought we would be more comfortable in a bigger room, so we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite! The room was much bigger that other rooms in Europe we had stayed in, and the bathroom was more than adequate. All spotless clean too. The whole hotel was clean and nicely decorated and the staff could not have been more helpful. The reception staff were excellent at giving directions and telling you what bus to get to the attractions and everyone spoke English. The area the hotel was in was really good - some of the reviews on here made it seem like it was out of the way, but I didn't think so. The Montparnasse area was full of shops and restaurants and the bus stops/metro was no more than a two or three minute walk away. We walked to the Louvre (it took about 25 minutes, but it was a pleasant walk past all the shops etc) and we also walked to Notre Damme (again about 25 minutes). It was about 20 minutes on a local bus to the Eiffel Tower and about the same to the Arc de Triumphe. We got the metro to Sacre Cour and that only took about 20 minutes too. It was really easy to get around and the hotel staff told you what bus to get, where to stand to catch the bus and where to get off at the other end. The breakfast in the hotel was lovely - plenty of choice and all well presented. And as I said, the area the hotel was in had loads of places to get a lunch and a dinner. I am a really fussy eater and I managed to find something to suit me! So in summary, I would have no hesitation in staying at the Victoria Palace again. It wally was an ideal place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: parfro
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel, though the ramp up 2 shallow steps should not have been a wooden one which reached one step and was far too narrow. I did ask them for the future of all disabled patrons to buy a proper one! However, the bedroom and bathroom were both large in size - the toilet had a raised toilet seat, a handrail which we moved along the side of the bath for convenience, but no grab rails anywhere. There was a large ledge to slide along at the end of the bath and a low slung bath seat (which I could not use.). The staff were charming and even tried to find me a wheelchair when my powered one broke down just before our daughter's wedding. The atmosphere was delightful with an intimate bar. Breakfast was generous.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Palace made our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Plenilune
Reviews.Content: Victoria Palace set the tone of our spontaneous, fun, exciting and cultural trip to France. We arrived very early (our flight landed at 7:30am) - but no problem, our room was ready! The staff was gracious and helpful and the location was perfect. It's not cheap, but you get what you pay for in spades. I am planning my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service; Surprisingly Large, Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: surrealus
Reviews.Content: All of the concierge staff, especially Nicolas, were helpful even before we arrived, providing information on anything we asked about. During our stay, the staff couldn't have been more helpful or courteous. Even the bartender, David, was great. Once you enter the hotel, you'll see two charming sitting areas on either side along with the bar to your right. The design of these rooms is what you imagine Paris to look like. Our room was beautifully decorated and larger than expected. (see photos) We were promised either a queen bed or two twins, but got a king. The bed itself was very firm, but we slept really well. The bathroom (all marble) was also bigger than expected. And the hotel provided plenty of amenities like robes, slippers, and bath salts, but no bottled water, coffee, or tea in the room. The breakfasts were very nice (not quite what you get at the Westin or Hotel Lutecia, but certainly enough). As we booked through Orbitz, breakfast was included. The hotel is on a one way street. Upon arrival by car I was concerned because all I could see was an ugly garage with the name of the hotel above it; however, when you walk up to the hotel from the other direction, you can see that it in fact is a charming building. The hotel is located at least a 30 minute walk from all of the major tourist attractions. It's near the metro line 4. If you've been to Paris before, have business in the vicinity, or like to be in an out of the way location -this hotel is for you. The hotel thoughtfully provides booklets with recommendations for local shopping, restaurants, and jogging trails. Note: there is no gym in the hotel, but one is available in the neighborhood for 20 euros per day. Wi-fi connections are available at 10 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff and wonderful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Travelers18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent three weeks at this hotel and found each day to be better than the next. The staff was friendly (including teaching me how to make their fabulous scrambled eggs) and helpful; suggesting and arranging a side trip to Brussels. We didn't want to leave as the hospitality was so incredible. The breakfast buffet is delicious and the service fabulous! Within easy walking distance are all the restaurants/cafes/brasserie's you could want as well as metro and bus stops. Small grocery stores are within two blocks and a laundry a bit further along. We have traveled all over the world for work and leisure and this hotel ranks as one of the best we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Farragut1980
Reviews.Content: SERVICE! SERVICE! SERVICE! This is the main reason to stay at this fine hotel. The staff was warm and welcoming, almost a throwback to a more mannerly time. The rooms are large (for Paris standards, anyway), as are the bathrooms. The hotel is quiet, as it is off the main street. While it is not all that close to many of the tourist attractions, it is a short walk to a big Metro station, so you can be anywhere in Paris in a short amount of time. I would highly recommend this fine hotel to anyone visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “No better hotel in Paris ! You will love it”
Reviews.Author: Jack448
Reviews.Content: The most wonderful hotel we have ever stayed in. A lovely, quite place to stay while visiting Paris. The staff will make you feel as if you are family and if visiting for the first time you will think you are a regular. We had a junior suite that was large and beautifully decorated. The front desk staff, led by Martin, recommended the most wonderful places to eat and provided advise as to the easist way to get around Paris. We have stayed in some wonderful hotels throughout the world but the Victoria Palace is tops on the list. Reasonable prices, GREAT BREAKFAST and a WONDERFUL STAFF !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: SundevilStudent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Victoria Palace for a week during my honeymoon, it's a fantastic hotel. Room was large (huge for Paris), clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The bed was firm but very comfortable. Two large built in armoires gave us plenty of room to unpack everything from our suitcases. Flat screen television with a large number of channels, well stocked mini-bar, a large writing, and three comfortable chairs rounded out the room. Bathroom was large (with ample space to set out all of out toiletries) and was restocked everyday with quality shampoo, soap, etc. Restocking of bath salts daily was a nice touch. Breakfast was ample, it would be tough for someone not to find something they liked. Off the top of my head, the buffet included: Yogurt, granola, oats, fruit, a couple of types of fruit salad, cereal, a number of juices, milk, eggs (hard boiled and scrambled), sausage (two types), bacon, baguettes and demi-baguettes, croissants, pain au chocolate, sliced bread, and a number of cold meats and cheeses. Staff was exceptional. More than wiling to help in any way possible and had an answer for any question you might have. They all, to a person, seemed to want to ensure that you had the best experience you could have while staying at the hotel. Location was great as well. Of the edge of the 6th in between the Montparnasse and St. Placide Metro stations on the 4th and close to the Rennes stop on the 12th. Walking distance to the St. Germain area, Luxembourg Gardens, and the Tulieries Gardens/Louvre. Would 100% stay here again, a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1angel7
Reviews.Content: First visit to Paris to celebrate our anniversary and spend time with our daughters who are students. Could not ask for a better hotel. It was charming, clean and beautiful. The staff was helpful and friendly. We felt welcome and at home. The buffet breakfast each morning was the perfect start to each day. The lounge was great in the evening to sit and relax and have champagne or a nice drink. The bathroom was sparkling and had great bath toiletries,a comfy robe and slippers. The bellman was wonderful as well as David the bartender and the front desk staff. Thank you all so much for a relaxing and welcoming stay at your beautiful hotel.
