Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: tvladv
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Found it to be very quiet and the staff was very attentive. Rooms are exactly as in the pictues. Bathroom was large and modern. The location near Montparnasse is perfect. Metros are less than a 5 minute walk. Highly recommend the Victoria Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more...”
Reviews.Author: shortyindenver
Reviews.Content: We used a travel agent to book our stay but relied upon the TripAdvisor ratings before we booked. The Victoria Palace is indeed a wonderful place. We stayed in a Junior Suite on the 7th floor and enjoyed a view of the Eiffel Tower from our window. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable and the staff very helpful and kind. The daily breakfast was also a special treat to begin each day. I would recommend the Victoria Palace to anyone going to Paris. It is located near shopping, cafes and Metro stations. And it is only a quick trip to the Left Bank attractions or even over to Sacre d'Coure. We would return to Victoria Palace without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: LynnBAustralia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. Our Junior Suite was excellent, clean and Spacious. Staff were friendly, helpful and effecient. Breakfast was enjoyable with a good variety. Hotel is in an excellent location. Close to restaurants and public transport. Prior to arriving at this hotel, we had been travelling for a couple of Months. Our 9 day stay refreshed us and gave us the much needed energy to continue our travels. For a great Parisan experience. I would recomend the Victoria Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: meikdahogo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of other reviews on tripadvisor, and my wife and myself were so charmed by the experience that she actually urged me to write this review! The hotel is situated about 300 meters from a subway station, which is ideal for us since we are avid public transport users (the public transport system in Paris - more specifically the subway - is fantastic, by the way!). The hotel is what we consider top class in a family-like environment. Genuine friendliness and helpfulness without being intrusive at all; the staff was simply "there", ready and willing to do whatever it took to make us happy, but never bothersome in any way! The next happy surprise was our room. We were on the seventh floor (top floor on this hotel) and found a large room, warmly decorated, with all comforts. We immediately had this important feeling of "coming home", something my wife and I truly treasure after long days of sight seeing. The bathroom was large, with a sit-in bath, and looked superb as well. Another happy surprise was the rich breakfast buffet with every kind of food that our hearts craved (mine does crave quite a lot :-), even if I dare add a little bit of critique there: the baguettes and croissants tasted "4 hours old": just not quite fresh enough for a city such as Paris, where on every corner you get such fantastically fresh bread. But this never ever lessened our excellent experience. Now the best thing: this hotel does have its own "Manuel". Only people within a certain age bracket and with a sense for British humor will understand this, all the others go get yourself a copy of Faulty Towers. :-) Understand that this person was not annoying, in fact, he was very polite and helpful, but his mannerism was so funny that this guy made our day every morning. (And a little hint: be friendly to him, because he is the one who will get you that extra coffee without having to be asked; he is wearing a white jacket and only working breakfast I think) And to end this rather long review on another positive note for this hotel: We will go back to Paris, and we would not think of searching for any other place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, but nice”
Reviews.Author: perthwa
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the previous review, we found the hotel very pleasant, nice and quiet, the breakfast was thoroughly enjoyable, in fact we have found our stay most pleasureable, staff have been very helpful, we usually stay in more branded hotels, our travel agent recommended us this hotel, as she has had other clients stay here, it came fully recommended it gave us the feeling we were well and truley in France

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbianchine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria palace for 6 nights in June. We had 2 connecting rooms for my husband and myself with our 17 year old son in the connecting room. I booked our rooms with the hotel manager Phillip who could not have been more accomodating. He was delightful beginning with booking our rooms and was just as wonderful throughout our stay. He even booked our hotel in Nice personally. The rooms were spacious and lovely, The location was perfect and within walking distance to everything we wanted to see and do. I had done extensive research when looking for a hotel in Paris. The VP was even better than I had anticipated. We will absolutely stay here again on our return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VKJ926
Reviews.Content: My daughter , 5 year old granddaughter and I had a wonderful week at the VP last March. Yes, we arrived early and had a wait, but we had not requested early arrival. Everyone was very polite, and kept us abreast of the expected time we would be able to get in our room. The room itself was lovely. They provided a nice small bed for my granddaughter and left her candy each nigh when they turned down our beds. They even laid her Paris coloring book on her bed as well! The spacious marble bathroom was beautiful. We found the staff helpful, cheerful, and spoke English well. I ate the eggs almost every day and found them just right. In fact, we thought the breakfast a wonderful value. We also enjoyed a glass of wine in the lovely lounge every day. It is quiet and the perfect place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. This was my daughter's second stay at the VP and we would stay there again. The only downside was that it is a little out of the way, but the positive aspects far outweighed that.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MGVA
Reviews.Content: My family and I (four adults) appreciated the unfailing courtesy, helpfulness, efficiency, and, above all, friendliness, we experienced during our recent eight day stay at the Victoria Palace. We have stayed in many wonderful hotels in the US and Europe, but we have rarely felt as comfortable or as well taken care of as we did there. We felt that the staff went out of their way, every day, to help us feel welcome and to enjoy Paris, and we very much appreciated their patient responses to all of our requests for help, no matter how late we made them or how silly they might have been. The concierge arranged difficult to get restaurant reservations and excellent tours, and had great suggestions for small but terrific non-tourist laden local places for dinner. We loved the location--on a quiet side street, but very close to 2 Metro lines, shopping, hotels and major tourist attractions--the large size and ambience of the rooms, the breakfast, the bar, and above all, the uniformly helpful and cheerful staff. We didnâ€™t really even notice the extensive hall way renovation work that is underway, which in itself was quite an accomplishment! To my mind, the sign of a truly great hotel is how welcome and comfortable I feel there, and by that measure, the VP is one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality and value in a very desireable location”
Reviews.Author: kelph
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Victoria Palace for 4 nights over the long President's Day weekend. We had a great experience and will certainly go back. We booked the hotel as part of of an air/hotel package offered by one of the airlines. Given the quality of the hotel , it was a great value. Our room was large (by European standards), very comfortable, very clean and quite charming; many thoughtful touches abounded (2 luggage racks, plenty of hangers, high quality robes and linens). The bathroom was quite luxurious - in general I have to say that the room/bath was definately a high 4 star experience. There seems to be a real emphasis on hospitality at the hotel; we arrived early ( well before check in time) but were quickly made welcome and shown to our room. Throughout our stay, members of the staff were consistenly and pleasantly helpful with recommendations, directions etc. Moreover, my daughter developed a sudden stomach flu very early on a Sunday morning; the overnight front desk staff first assisted in finding me an open pharmacy and a taxi to take me there and back and then (when my daughter did not seem to be getting better) secured for me an English speaking doctor who within an hour made a house call to the hotel! Happily, my daughter recovered within a day. The Hotel by the way sent up a tray of the light food/liquid ordered by the doctor and refused to charge for it! Finally- 2 other pluses deserve mention- the buffet breakfast was very good indeed (included in our room rate). Also, the location is excellant- an easy walk to Blvd Saint-Germain and the Luxumberg Garden and right around the corner from Montparnesse. . .

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: PeterandAnne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Victoria Palace for 7 nights late August early September. A friend had recommended the hotel and, before booking, we continually checked the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were certainly not disappointed when we arrived. We found ALL of the staff very helpful, attentive and polite - particularly the gentleman who was the Director of Sales. The breakfast at the Victoria Palace was wonderful. Our room was great. The hotelâ€™s location is perfect â€“ not only to catch buses or the metro but also there are nearby shops and restaurants where the locals shop and eat. There is also a convenience store about 50 metres from the hotel. We have been heartened by the overwhelming positive reviews that the Victoria Palace has received on Trip Advisor which we believe that this hotel richly deserves. The hotel is a true gem and we will definitely stay there again when we return to Paris. Anne & Peter Adelaide Australia

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: drjeff1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Victoria Palace for a week while we were attending a conference at the Institut Pasteur. We absolutely loved it. The rooms are quite large for a European hotel. The bathroom was luxurious and large as well. One oddity was that there was a separate (and also large) room for the toilet, so you had to go into another room to wash your hands, but that was a minor inconvenience. The room was kept immaculately clean. The staff were all very friendly and all spoke English. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk north of Montparnasse. We were able to walk easily to Le Bon Marche, the Rodin Museum, the Sorbonne area, and the Eiffel Tower. In addition to the large train/metro station at Montparnasse, there are two other tube stops within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The area is mostly residential, but has quite a bit of shopping on Rue de Rennes, which is the major cross street near the hotel. We found it to be quiet and not at all touristy until we got near Montparnasse. The breakfast included was spectacular- if you can't find good food in that spread, there's something seriously wrong with you. All in all our stay could not have been better and I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Hospitality in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler007
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris early in the morning after a flight from the U.S.A. When we went to check in at the Victoria Palace, our room was ready and they quickly accommodated us ... what a wonderful welcome to jet-lagged tourists! The room was impeccably clean, had a large bathroom, and lots of closets. The hotel staff was highly professional, spoke English well, and answered every question we had. Custom guides and maps of the surrounding neighborhood were interesting and useful. The hotel is located in a quiet, non-touristy area of Paris, but is close to a Metro station. This was a quiet hotel, with non-smoking public areas, including the bar. The breakfast was well-suited to American appetites. I highly recommend the Victoria Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Baby-friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: leftbankCanada
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the old-fashioned authentically Parisian experience offered by this hotel. Our baby was welcomed by all staff and a high chair and crib were available to us for no extra charge. We were pleased with the reduced fee we got for booking on-line under non-refundable conditions, with breakfast included. The staff allowed Mom to eat breakfast in the room while baby slept in and Dad ate the more complete meal downstairs (eggs, meat only offered in the breakfast room). The location is fabulous if you are a left bank devotee like us, every outing involves a trip by the Jardin de Luxembourg. For a hotel that pampers and replenishes your energy, stay at the Victoria Palace!

Reviews.Title: “The Victoria Palace - Parisianne Gem”
Reviews.Author: maisiegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay @ the Victoria Palace Hotel in Paris, France via United Vacations.com, after reading a variety of reviews. It is a luxury hotel providing excellent service. All of our needs were met, the hotel room was large by European standards, beds were comfortable and our room was quiet. More importantly, all staff at this hotel paid attention to and met any needs we may have had; they were wonderful and personable. This hotel has a great locale and one can easily walk to many sites such as Musee Rodin, Luxumbourg Gardens, the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay & the Louvre, to strolling Saint German du Pres, etc. Additionally, wonderful eateries are within a few steps of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the double espressos excellent. The hotel bar was fun and the bartenders most welcoming and conversational with guests!!!!! I look forward to staying at this hotel upon my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanbo
Reviews.Content: After researching Trip Advisor, we chose the Victoria Palace for its reviews and price. After a long flight with little sleep the night before we left, we were very pleased with our very cool and very quiet room. Service was very good. We relaxed at the Victoria Palace. Yes, as one reviewer wrote, the eggs were runny and the breakfast was average. I found this to be true of 4 out of the 5 hotels we stayed in through France and Italy. I was glad it was included in our package because breakfast can be very expensive. We did alot of walking due to the location but we didn't mind. All in all, we had a nice stay. They have a nice little bar when you enter that is great for a nightcap and also they do not charge for use of the internet or computer as all of the rest of the hotels did. Just beware of the french keyboard! They will help with it if you need it. It wasn't the best hotel but we felt it was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, awful service”
Reviews.Author: ldjsue
Reviews.Content: Some pluses: Big rooms, nice size bathrooms, air conditioning Negatives: Staff awful, rude, The WORST restaurant suggestyins. The absolute worst meal we had in Europe by their suggestion. We got in on an early flight with tired children and they were not at all helpful, despite the hotel being fairly emprty. Breakfast is average, again nothing special given you are in Paris and should have excellent food. Nothing great at this hotel, location is far from attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: mixercat
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I,in our early 20's, stayed in the Victoria Palace as our first stay in Paris. I booked the hotel as a surprise for his birthday and paid more money especially as I wanted a luxurious hotel as we have been disappointed in the past. The hotel is in a pretty good area, easily accessible to metro,busses and restaurants. The street just off the hotel is full of shops which are all open until about 7p.m. We were pleased with the reception that greeted us as it is smart and the lady who was on reception was very polite and effecient when sorting us out with our room. The room itself (606) was a decent size, carpet was well worn, the decor not to our taste but it is an old fashioned hotel. The mini bar and snacks were expensive and the fridge didnt work. The flat screen t.v is nice but we could only find 2 english channels but mtv france is worth a look just for a laugh lol.The bed is quite hard but not so it made much difference to us sleeping (we were always too tired to care after very busy days).It is hard to get the room to the temperature you require especially at night, it was always either too warm or cold. There was a safe in our room which was free to use and in the wardrobe came with dressing gowns and slippers. The bathroom is nice, made with marble and with 3 mirrors, one full length, a large mirror over the sink and a close up mirror for shaving. Quite a random point, but we found it very difficult to get the plugs out of the sink and the bath. There is a pretty good hair dryer, a selection of shampoo,conditioner,shower gel, body lotion and other bathroom necessities. The water was off for the majority of 2 days we were staying there but were we were given no notice of this and offered no apologies or compensation of any kind. We didnt mind but they could have been more considerate. There is a large selection at breakfast but we found the scrambled eggs runny and there was some mouldy fruit in the fruit basket, not very proffesional. Some staff were good whereas others were unhelpful, when we asked if there were any good chinese restaurants in the area we were given a map and told they thought there was one on a corner, he couldnt tell us what it was called but he thought there was one there, there wasnt. Also, we asked for a taxi to be booked for a certain time and when we went outside the meter was already at 10 euros, when I asked at reception why this was all he said was that in paris when you ring for a taxi you are charged for it from when you ring for it. I asked why he rang it 15 minutes earlier than we asked for it and he just shrugged his shoulders. When asked if they would do anything about it he just said no. By the time I got back to the taxi it had gone up even more but we had no choice but to get in it as we needed to get to the airport. There was also a member of staff who came into the room on 2 occasions where we didnt hear him knock and even though the 'please do not disturb' sign was on. The cleaners come in your room regardless of the sign as well so be warned. If visiting Paris this is a good base to have as it is in a quiet part of the city without being too far away and is generally a nice hotel. We found a combination of metro and walking was perfect for us as it allowed us to see everything we wanted in a short time. An all day metro pass is 5.60 euros and allows you to get around paris much quicker than if you were walking. I'd recommend a good metro guide as it makes travelling around so much easier. Also when booking the hotel check around websites for good deals as i paid a lot less than the 320 euros a night which is advertised. Overall Paris is a beautiful place to visit which I would advise anyone to go and see even though we found many of the French people very rude. Not sure if this is their culture or just because they dont like tourists?

Reviews.Title: “A quality experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeB99
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay at this hotel at the end of July. We have stayed in Paris many times, know Paris well, and this is the best experience we have had. We booked the hotel through Hotel Connect online, and had a very good rate for this 4 star hotel which, for Paris, represented good value. It is no distance at all from the Seine, just a few minutes on the bus. Four routes travel down the Rue de Rennes, and the stops are 3 minutes' walk from the hotel. The Montparnasse metro is 5 minutes' walk. As Parisians will tell you, there is really no centre to this city. So, easy access to transport, is vital. In our experience, it is much pleasanter and better value to stay in an area like this which is not right next to the tourist attractions. In any case, since Paris is a city where you will always have to travel some distance to see the sights; even if you get a hotel next to the Louvre, it will still be a longish journey to La DÃ©fense, or the Eiffel Tower. The side street location gets you a good night's sleep, well away from the otherwise inevitable city noise. As a family group, we requested a twin room and a double room, preferably adjacent. We were given a room which had one entrance, a lobby, two separate doors, leading to two separate rooms with private facilities. The quality of the decor was outstanding, and it is notable that the recent refurbishment has used materials which can endure the wear and tear of heavy tourist use. The style is deliberately victorian pastiche - and every attention to detail makes it charming and different from the bland chain hotels which are taking over in Paris. Cleanliness is of a high standard, and it is reassuring to see the House Manageress touring the hotel at almost any time of day you happen to be there, checking the rooms and the work that is being done. All the staff, from reception to service personnel, are immaculately dressed, extremely helpful, and welcoming. The buffet breakfast is very good indeed, with a wide choice of European food, and plenty of healthy options. Homemade preserves, lots of fresh fruit, but also traditional bacon and eggs, mean that all but the American taste for stacks of pancakes and waffles is catered for. Again, comparing this with other hotels, you would not find better at this price, and often much more basic. There are several cafes and restaurants within a short walk of the hotel, if you prefer to eat locally. Overall, our view is that this hotel is excellent value in every sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Victoria Palace. I booked the room, as I do all of my hotel stays, based on the reviews of Trip Advisor. On the plus side, the staff was terrific and gave us incredible restaurants tips every evening. They were also great about calling us cabs and answering any question we had. On the down side, the hotel is not in a terrific area. As you walk off the hotel's street to the main street, you see a McDonald's and Footlocker--reminded me of 14th Street in Manhattan. Also, you are a great distance from the Siene and for our visit most every thing we did required a cab ride. Also, the hotel was frankly "tired"--the carpets were stained, the room not updated. It would have been fine if it had been inexpensive, but for 320 euros we were expecting more (especially as I stayed at another place for 200 euros earlier in the year that was much more elegant and in a more central location.)

Reviews.Title: “French, Formal and Oh so Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Waretoonext
Reviews.Content: 6nights at Victoria Palace -- French, Formal and Lovely If you want to know that you are in Paris then stay at the Victoria Palace. The Rooms are traditionally decorated and oh so roomy for France. The bathrooms are great! Especially after walking over 12 hours a day, to come home to a deep marble tub is the best! Beds are comfortable and the pillows dont give you a neckache. I had a deluxe room and it was just all that you could ask for, my bathroom was very large, but be aware, other deluxe rooms can have smaller bathrooms. Because of my location i also had two additional big closets ( a total of 4 altogether) in the entry way to the room! Very quiet corner location. Rm 110. The ground floor is Zero. You cannot go wrong with this room. USE a travel agent to book this hotel. I got a rate that included breakfast and all taxes and it was over $150 Euros less then the stated rate, especially if you book way in advance. I had my reservation for over 6months. Location: Just fine, within walking distance of cafes, St. Germain, Luxembourg Gardens, Bon Marche, Rue Cherche Midi, etc. Two convenient Metros. Special Note, the Montparnasse Metro Line feeds into many others and I found it the easiest and most effective to getting around the city. The St. Placide lines only really serves the St. Germain, Notre Dame and Latin quarter. Hotel sits on side street. Very important for noise control. Most all other hotels on very very busy streets. Dont miss the Rue Cherche Midi neighborhood, turn left when you leave the hotel and go over a couple of blocks. Famous Pouilane Bakery and adorable shops, keep walking and you will find anything you could look for. Staff: Formal and Professional, they will answer any question you ask. Be specific, they know english but are very literal. You can exchange small amounts of money and even mail your postcards at the front desk. The door staff will speak every time you enter and leave. The rest of the staff kind of avoid eye contact unless you have a question. Not in a rude way, but in a "we dont want to bother you, kind of way." Breakfast: Adequate. But you will find no better, american breakfast is non-existent and as it should be. You may get tired of the same thing every day but I advise you to do the breakfast, later in the day you will be glad. Try to get it included in your room rate. Ours was and then you feel like it is for free! If not many local patisseries around. I would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend to everyone. I researched hotels for months, found none better for location, quality and comfort. After arriving and seeing how many of the hotels windows face Bustling NY type of streets i was oh so glad i chose this hotel. Also special note, when in a taxi give cross streets, they wont know the tiny little street it sits on. They will know immediatley the cross streets. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Stay”
Reviews.Author: ruienc
Reviews.Content: Nice room, chocolates all nights. Excelent look and feel. Great location. One of the best breakfasts I ever seem... Staff is very helpfull. Very quiet. In one word excellent... for those you like James Joyce be aware that he lived in the hotel for a period of time....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ovid21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Palace Hotel for 5 nights in April 2007. Over the years, we have stayed in many different Paris hotels, but this is definately one of our favorites. We prefer staying on the left bank but not in the overly touristy areas. The Victoria Palace is nicely located on a quiet street just off Rue de Rennes. Although it is in more native, less touristy area, it is still easy walking distance to the Musee de Orsay, Jardin du Luxembourg, St Germain des Pres, Notre Dame, etc. My wife liked the shopping in the area around the hotel and there were also many good restaurants and cafes nearby. A lively, active street market is a few blocks away on Blvd Raspail (only certain mornings). We stayed in a Jr Suite with a queen bed and a rollway bed for our daughter. The room was spacious enough to accomodate all three of us comfortably. The decor was with very traditional, decorative fabric wall covering. Nice marble bathroom. Very good hot breakfast was included in room price. Lobby sitting room and bar area are both very comfortable. Really can't think of anything negative about our stay here. We would definately stay here again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Merci Victoria Palace”
Reviews.Author: rcon16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our honeymoon in Paris and the Victoria Palace was almost perfect. The superior double room was roomy and had a great bathroom. Chocolates every evening with the next day's weather forecast was a nice touch. We found the hotel employees extremely helpful recommending tours, directions and helping us with bookings. I did not mind the locaiton of the hotel which was admittedly a little out of the way from the major sites, however it was a little annoying that no taxi driver had heard of our street. If you stay at this hotel, you MUST carry around the hotel address so the taxi can use GPS (which they all have - excellent!) to find their way. One taxi driver said he had driven for 30 years in Paris and there were hardly any streets he did now know - but ours was one. Anyway- I would still recommend the hotel since it is quite nice and romantic. It is also close to a number of great streets with shops that you probably will miss if you stay in one of the more touristy neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cheledonna
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent touted this hotel as did this website so we were a bit disapointed. Our superior double room was larger than most at this price which was good. Minuses- undercooked scrambled eggs at breakfast gave myhusband and I both a bad "next" day... the circulation in the room is poor and you hvae to open the windows which brings in the noise - they turn off the "system" at around 1 AM... so beware... Also, we found the staff just "ok" - not that informed. We were taking the train to Avignon (Gare du Lyon) and the girl behind the desk urged us to be there an hour ahead for reasons of "security".... NOT TRUE - we could have gotten there 10 minutes ahead and been fine - there is no security - she just had the wrong information.... Hotel is a bit faded in many ways and on the outskirts of the 6th... although not a problem for us. Next visit to Paris I'd like to try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Romantique!”
Reviews.Author: Gawain44
Reviews.Content: This was the final leg of our honeymoon in France, and the Victoria Palace did not disappoint! Very friendly and helpful staff, Aurore personally showed us to our room and explained all about the hotel and surrounding area. The location is very convienient, and the walk to the Seine, Latin Quarter and St. Germaine is very easy and pleasant. Don't forget to visit the Jardin Luxembourg nearby for a relaxing time in a beautiful park. We asked the staff on two occasions to recommend a good restaurant, and both were fabulous...C'est Mon Placieux and Christine were both great dining experiences that we will definitely revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmielou01
Reviews.Content: The Victoria Palace is a very nice, beautiful property with extremely friendly and attentive staff. Great location (near 2 metro stops). Our room was very clean and comfortable. Our only complaint is that it appears that the Victoria is a hotel used frequently by large bus-tour groups. CROWDS of people in the lobby checking in at once (or trying to) and checking out at once, suitcases in the halls, noise, etc. My husband and I had quite a shock when one guest apparently believed that the lovely breakfast room at the hotel was the same as having breakfast in her kitchen, in that she appeared in her short, silky nightgown and slippers. Other than the incoming and outgoing crowds, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Approved”
Reviews.Author: PaulFoleyTravel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with plenty of atmosphere - excellent service, and beautifully appointed rooms. I would have no trouble recommending for my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Very French, Very clean”
Reviews.Author: CLI71
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in a Junior Suite here - room was a really good size and so was the bathroom. The staff were extremely helpful. This is a old style hotel but decorated to a high standard, everythin is spotless and u have mod cons like flat screen tv, mini bar, excellent hairdryer etc. The only thing i didn't like about the hotel was the beds were very firm and they used sheets and blankets rather than duvets. It is near to metro stops etc. We spent most of out time in St. Germain which is a brisk 10/15 minute walk. Try Le Petite Zinc restaurant if u can find find it near St Germain metro stop. Paris is a beautiful city and we still managed to enjoy it, despite it raining the whole time we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights in a junior suite. The hotel is quiet and rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel is on a quiet side street, with easy access to Metro stations and buses. You can be in Louvre area within 15 minutes by Metro. Many days we took Metro one way and made our way back on foot. Lots of shopping nearby--clothes, shoes, handbags, electronics, plus small supermarket on the corner. We used the small minibar fridge to store our room "picnics"--tons of cheeses, salamis and, of course, wine. Bathroom is good sized, all marble. The shower water pressure is great. Good lighting. We only had room service once--incredibly overpriced, but that's why room service exists, right? It was approx $23 for coffee and croissants for one person. Coffee people beware: There's nowhere in hotel to just get coffee without buying breakfast. There are many places for coffee nearby including Starbucks. The only "negatives" are pretty minor: bed was made of cement and heat was hard to control--we spent most nights opening windows intermittently to cool down room. Another oddity--hotel staff walked in on us three times to either do turndown service or check mini bar. Never heard a knock. So be sure to bolt door for assured privacy. The service is what sets the hotel apart. Everyone was exceedingly gracious and helpful. Every request we had was handled beautifully. We would stay here again. P.S. Other reviews mention an Eiffel Tower view from one of the rooms. According to hotel staff, there is no such view from any room.

Reviews.Title: “A beutiful location, perfect.”
Reviews.Author: pixiepurls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Christmas Eve 2006. We stayed for 3 nights total. We payed $300 and had a large bed. We simply adored this hotel, they worked for 15 minutes to get us a taxi durring the difficult 7pm time (apparently it's hard to get taxi's at 7 in that area because everyone is going to dinner!) and yhey made reservations for us at a nice resturant for XMAS eve. Everything they reccomended was perfect and we actually walked back form the Lourve! We walked all over the place. It's just a lovely area to stay and just fine if you are taking the Metro etc. I have heard from people that the french can be rude but EVERYONE was nice to us, the people at the hotel spoke very good english. The bathroom was wall to wall marble, and I snagged the cute emboirdered bed slippers :) Our room was a standard and it had 2 balconies! Both where small but we had a nice view of the main street. It's right across the street from FNAC which is kind of like a much better best buy, so anything you will need you can get there! This was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at, it was simply worth every penny, the staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Palace is lovely”
Reviews.Author: fingirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel after a four night stay over new years. Most of the reviews are accurate but since we rely so much on trip advisor it seems only fair to add our observations too. Pros: The rooms are clean and suprisingly soundproof. We never heard our neighbors one either side and only heard the people above us on one morning when we presume some kids were running around:). The shower has good pressure and the bathroom was a good size. The staff was very nice. Isabelle (front desk) had some awesome dining suggestions (try C'est Mon Plaisar and Allard-- both awesome) and was always available to help and very pleasant. Habib (in the bar/lounge) was by far the most friendly person we met in Paris -- tell him his friends from Fort Worth say hello. The breakfast was fine (but just average) and if more had been open outside the hotel ( A LOT is closed on new years day in particular) we probably would have preferred to eat nearby for the ambiance. The hotel is quiet and intimate (we were suprised at breakfast to even see so many other people b/c it never felt busy or loud or crowded). There was a computer available in the lobby area to check email, etc.. which was convenient too. Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel -- especially to first timers. Cons: Really the only one to us was that the hotel was not quite as centrally located as we would have liked. It is in a good area w/ shopping, dining etc.. and has a lot of charm. In fact, although we would love to have stayed at George V itself we have to say we much preferred VP's area to the Champs area -- which would have been more inconvenient and which felt like a mall! The location problem for us was because we preferred to walk rather than take the metro or buses (so we could see everything!) so VP was a little more out of the way from some of the big "tourists attractions". It is easy to take the metro or buses though and avoid this issue -- so it is kind of our own fault. Also the beds are really hard. While this does not bother us at all we know from many trip advisor reviews that this is an issue for a lot of travelers generally so if you fall into that category be forewarned. Even in January w/ rain Paris is beautiful so eat a crepe, walk the streets, see St. Chappelle and marvel at the architecture and history of the city!

Reviews.Title: “what a delightfull place”
Reviews.Author: estherea
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day stay at this wonderfull hotel. I selected this place after having read the reviews in tripadvisor and I was defenitely not disappointed by it. The atmosphere in the hotel, the staff and the room was exactly what I was looking for. The room was clean, large and well furnished and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. After spending the entire day is very busy Paris it was like taking a warm bath when returning to the hotel at the end of the day. The hotel recommended a restaurant for the Saturday night which was really good and they organised a small chocolate cake for my birthday which was more than delicious. If you are looking for a classy delightfull hotel, stay at the Victoria Palace hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the VP!!”
Reviews.Author: tamboer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely 2 night stay at the Victoria Palace. From the moment we checked in the hotel staff was friendly, informative, and courteous. Sebastian at the front desk took us up to our room to show us around. The room (607) had access to two balconies, queen size bed, large bathroom, and was very nicely decorated and maintained. The breakfast was terrific as was the service and the it seemed someone was always around to answer questions. There's a free internet connection on a computer in the telephone booth next to the front desk. The lobby has a nice bar and an inviting sitting area with plenty of chairs if you just want to rest your tired feet from walking around the city streets. Short walk to the Metro and bus (10 minutes to the Louvre on the 95 bus). Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. I would highly recommend the Victoria Palace if you are looking for a reasonably priced (by Paris standards), warm and inviting stay on the left bank in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “what a treat!”
Reviews.Author: clydester
Reviews.Content: I found this GREAT hotel online thru trip advisor, for all the hotels to choose from in paris this one should stand out even higher than most! GREAT room GREAT staff GREAT location GREAT shopping nearby if you know your way around paris via the metro system then you should have to only get a cab to this hotel and then back to the airport. the metro system was within walking distance. we stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon and wow what a room! it was VERY clean and maintained. all requests that i had done prior where done to perfection !! all i can say is you'll not be dissatisfied. if you are its not because of this hotel or its staff. like the old saying "you get what you paid for" in my opinion i got more than that , just in the level of service alone.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limori
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel and its staff very charming and welcoming. It was the perfect hotel to the perfect trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JW150852
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Victoria Palace and would thoroughly recommend it for those looking for a quiet, smallish hotel (63 rooms) in the City Centre. We had travelled from the Anger into Montparnasse station which is in easy walking distance of the hotel hidden away off the busy Rue de Renne. We opted for a junior suite and were not dissappointed. Large room, beautifully decorated with spacious bathroom. Just right to help recover from those long days walking the many Paris sites. The breakfast was excellent, as long as you don't miss a big fry up, but with fresh fruit , excellent bread , cheese etc. this is really what we expected and hoped for in Paris. There is no evening restuarant although they do offer room service. However with endless eating choices nearby this is not a problem. The hotel tend to suggest the more expensive restaurants , which are worth the experience but some of the nearby bars and bistros offer an excellent alternative at a third of the price. One we liked was called Le Rousseau in the Rue du Cherche-Midi, just 5 mintues walk away. The building next door is undergoing some refurbishment at present and some noise can start from about 8am. If you like a long sleep then it might be an idea to ask from a room away from this until it is finished. We flew home from Orly airport, a 25 euro taxi ride from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: thalliii
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 10 night stay at the Victoria Palace Hotel in September 2006. The staff was most helpful, the junior suite was very large and well appointed, and our stay could not have been much better. It is only a short walk to the nearest metro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel part of excellent package”
Reviews.Author: dolphinmonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a find, and such good deal! We booked our monthlong vacation to France and Italy with Air France Holidays. The staff at Air France Holidays were so incredibly knowledgable and friendly it was amazing, you can't find customer service like this anymore! they knew every little detail about the Victoria Palace, had restaurant recommendations, information on sightseeing, and all sorts of insider information on not only paris, but all of France and Italy to boot! I loved the hotel, it was on a quiet street in a vital neighborhood. Please do yourself a favor, stay at the Victoria palace, and book your holiday with Air France Holidays!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: tayock
Reviews.Content: Excellent, loved my stay. The hotel was gorgous and lovely decorated, very traditional. The staff was so friendly, they gave us complimentry cocktails on arrival, the room was immaculate and had lots of lovely extras that just made it a perfect holiday. The breakfast was ok, just a small buffet but done the trick. Would recommend to everyone, one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “an average , well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: rnlg1967
Reviews.Content: how anyone describe this hotel with so much enthusiasm is beyond me. it is a perfectly reasonable, well run hotel with average rooms. I am genuinely not a snob, but if, like me, you read previous reviews and actually book in to the hotel I would be amazed if you are not disappointed when you arrive. I booked a deluxe suite for 3 nights and thought they had made a mistake, apparently we were in one of the biggest rooms they have. the room was really a standard double size at best , bed was large but everything else a let down. the furntiure old (not in a quaint way) carpet covered in lots of stains, very basic mini bar, who on earth described theirs as well stocked is clearly teetotal or blind. prices a complete rip off (â‚¬7 for a small box of pretzels, â‚¬6 for a beer) . the Bathroom was basic as well, perfectly funtcional but just becuase the sink and bath panel are in marble it does not constitute a "luxury bathroom". the windows were impossible to open properly and the "view of the courtyard" needed clever postioning of 4 mirrors to catch a glimpse of. if you want a convenient hotel with average facilites, its fine. if you want pampering, a touch of luxury etc then you wont find it here.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel ! We loved it !”
Reviews.Author: FlowerLover77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this 4-Star hotel for 4 nights in early August, celebrating our 20th Anniversary. The hotel is located on the Left Bank, on a very quiet side street off Rue de Rennes, about a 5-minute walk from the train station "Gare Montparnasse" and the Metro subway system. Based on a price comparison to 4-Star hotels on the Right Bank, this hotel was an incredible deal ! We had a "deluxe room", which was a nice size (normal American standard-sized room) with a very comfortable queen-sized bed. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the room had flowered, cloth wallpaper, a very clean carpet, and a ~17-inch flat panel TV. The bathroom had marble walls and floor, and very nice toiletries were provided each day. The room was straightened twice each day - once in the late morning and once in the early evening, including turn-down service with chocolates on the bed and a hand-written note indicating the anticipated weather for the next day. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, and very willing to call our selected restaurant to make a dinner reservation for us, and to call our car rental company to confirm our car rental (I had requested this since our French is not great). The front desk manager (hotel manager?) was extremely nice. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated and looks exactly like the photos on their website. We initially were given a room on Floor 3 (the lobby was considered Floor 0, so our room was 4 floors up from the lobby). When I saw the elevator near the front desk and saw that it was very small compared to American standards (maybe it would fit 3 people ), I mentioned to the porter that I would rather walk up the stairs. The front desk manager overheard me and immediately insisted that we take a room on the 1st Floor before I even took a few steps up the stairway - within 30 seconds he had the room changed - what incredible service ! The breakfast was served in a very clean dining room adjacent to the lobby and was quite a spread - the cold items were various cheeses, various cold cuts, various fruit, yogurt, granola, and various breads/pastries, while the hot items were scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage. The coffee was great !! The same types of food were provided each day, For shopping, there were many small, upscale stores within a block on Rue de Rennes. We completely loved this hotel and will stay here again next time we're in Paris !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely managed with class!”
Reviews.Author: Lorik1959
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful choice. It is not far from the Latin Quarter which turned out to be my absolute favorite area in Paris! The hotel is smaller and so elegant! The best part about this hotel is the kind and classy management. This is so important while you are in a foreign city. When you come in to your hotel after a long hard day of sight seeing, it is so important to feel as if you are coming home and that you will have these kind people watching over you. They are also the people that you can trust to assist you during your stay. This is a wonderful hotel! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: pmode
Reviews.Content: We loved the Victoria palace! Huge, nicely decorated room. By europe standards, it felt like a suite! The bathroom was gorgeous and was always well stocked with nice soaps, bath gels and salts. Extremely clean. The lobby and bar areas are gorgeous and the breakfast was great- fresh fruits, breads, yogurt along with meats and cheeses. Someone had made a comment about the cooked breakfast not being good. well that is done to cater to the americans who may be afraid to try what the locals eat. This hotel is about a 10-minute walk from the heart of St. Germain De pres and Latin Quarter. We actually loved the location because it wasn't filled with tourists and had more of a local feel. it is close to at least two metro stops that we used regularly (St. Placide and Rennes) some people may find that it is too far from things, but if you like to walk then no problem! The staff was wonderful and extremely accomodating. its true the staff all spoke wonderful english. but the thing many Americans forget is that we are visiting their country and every effort should be made to at least speak some french. I found it very rude to see some Americans not even trying. it gives all of us a bad name! you cannot go wrong with this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok just got back from a couple of nights staying at the Victoria Palace Hotel in Paris. Booked it based on its tripadvisor status of number 1 at the time. The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are well maintained and are what you expect from this sort of price range. We were looking over the inner courtyard but we were paying a middling price though. The location isn't the best in Paris but its close to a few metros and Montparnasse which has a number of lively cafes. The breakfasts were varied, as long as you dont go for the cooked. Perhaps the French just dont do cooked breakfasts well? Not what you expect for the price. We also arranged for a limo from the Station to the hotel which was never booked by the hotel and I wasn't informed and the bar shut at 12.30 when it should have been 1am, so check that with them if you've just got back for a night cap. Not all bad but expect more on the finer details for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: kingbingo1
Reviews.Content: Victoria palace is in the heart of the Montparnasse district, down a small street from a main street of French shops, a French version of America's Best Buy, FootLocker and McDonald's. It is just a couple of blocks from a Metro stop, so very convenient to many other locations. The hotel itself has the grand, elegant decor that we prefer over the more moderne look, providing the ambience Paris is so well known for, despite the modern surroundings. The room is a nice size and very comfortable with a king size bed (didn't even notice if it were twin beds pushed together or not) and a sizeable bathroom. A comfortable bathroom is very important to me. We are able to provide a picture of the bathroom, but we took over the room too fast to provide a picture of the room itself without all our baggage in the way. The staff was warm, friendly, informative and not stuffy at all. It was a great haven after trudging the streets of Paris all day. The only problem was that our room faced a concrete inner courtyard surrounded by other hotel rooms. Not a great view at all, but the room itself made up for it. The price and the decor would make it an absolutely perfect hotel if it were uprooted and placed near in the Champs Elysee district which we find to be a preferable location. But we still enjoyed the location in Montparnasse district just to experience another one of Paris' neighborhoods. Excellent hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I find victoria palace really lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “petite and perfect”
Reviews.Author: pzrad
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms at the Victoria Palace for two nights in March of 2006. We decided to stay at the Victoria based solely on Tripadvisor reviews. The reviews were accurate and the hotel is a wonderful little gem! I was initially slightly apprensive when our taxi driver had to get out his map to find rue Blaise Desgoffe but the hotel is only half a block off rue de Renne and about two blocks from Montparnasse square. The location is ideal for shopping, dining and sight seeing. Also about two blocks from the Metro in either direction( north/south). Accomadations were very nice. Large rooms with large comfortable beds, newly redone marble laden bathrooms, nice furniture with tasteful wall and window treatments. The rooms were a little hot and we could only really regulate the room temperature by opening the windows. This worked fine in March but I can't comment on the A/C in summer. Small flat screen TV in each room (nice) and free interet access in a small room off the hotel foyer (we didn't bring a lap top but I'll NEVER go abroad again without one. Breakfast buffet was included with our booking. This food was fine, plentiful and Parisian. I would not say that this was the quality of meal that you're going to rave to your friends about when you get back home. However, you can save that rave for dinner. The concierge recommended a small local restaurant for dinner. This was too small for my liking(limited menu) but my wife loved it. It's kind of hard to go wrong with the food in Paris (especially after just being in London). The hotel staff were attentive, helpful and friendly; nothing lost or stolen. They really helped us put together a plan for getting across the city to the train station after the city was paralyzed by a student demonstration and taxis couldn't cross through the demonstration. The hotel location is quiet at night and this was an added bonus to the tired tourist. The only potential problem with the Victoria is the fact that there is only one central staircase to act as an egress in the event of a fire. I am not trying to be an alarmist but if there was a fire in the middle of the hotel then there might be no way to get out except a window. All our windows opened on to a central atrium without access to the street. I suspect that this situation is common to many of the older hotels in Europe but I'm trying to be candid and accurate. I really enjoyed my stay at the Victoria and would not hesitate to return again. It's not the Westin or the Ritz or the Dorchester but it's tasteful, pleasant, personable, kind of funky in a good sort of Parisian way, cute, affordable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews were Accurate”
Reviews.Author: Paulownia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned (June 2006) from our two week trip in Paris. My husband and I are frequent travellers to big cities; during the past few years we have always stayed in four or five star hotels (in New York, London, Hong Kong, San Francisco, Mexico City) so this review is based on our experiences at the Hotel Victoria Palace compared to other four star hotels in major cities. I had been to Paris twice before this trip but had never stayed in the left bank side, so I used the hotel reviews posted on TripAdvisor to make my final decision about Victoria Palace. We were very pleased and relieved when we got there that the reviews were quite accurate about the hotel. The staff is well-trained, attentive and friendly. They all speak good English, if you don't speak French and need help with booking reservations for restaurants, shows, etc. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. Water pressure for the toilet and shower is very good too, so you won't have to huddle under the shower head with water trickling down you. For those who are internet and e-mail addicts (like my husband), you can get internet connection (and wireless connection if your laptop is set up for it). The rooms are equipped with a full bathroom, hairdryer, magnifying mirror in bathroom, television, air conditioning, mini-bar, phone of course, but there were other amenities not listed on their website which we found very convenient and to our liking. For example, to charge your electric appliances from the US (cell phones, laptop, shaver, etc), you need an American to French outlet adaptor, but there is no need to buy or bring one from the US since you can borrow one from the hotel. Dry cleaning and laundry services are of course available, but a clothesline attached to the bathroom wall was very handy for us, to wash undergarments and other delicates. We also had a security box in our room to keep our valuables- I imagine that all rooms are equipped with them. Another great feature of the hotel was its location. It is very conveniently located to the metro stops St. Placide, Rennes and Montpanasse-Bienvenue. We prefer window-shopping, people watching and walking, so we walked everywhere, including the Orsay Museum, Pompidou, Louvre, Printemps department store, Guimet museum from our hotel. The owner of the hotel also knows what he's talking about when it comes to good food. When you check-in, they will give you a list of restaurants nearby (all walking distance) that they recommend. At first we tried places we looked up ourselves in our guidebooks but soon gave up trying because the hotel's recommendations were far superior and accurate. I think we tried six of the restaurants they recommended and they were all absolutely wonderful and reasonably priced. If we had anything negative to say about this hotel it would probably be their breakfast and their bed. We didn't think the breakfast there is anything special, though it wasn't bad either. They don't use down comforters for their beds (which would be a really nice plus) but instead use those thin hotel blankets and hard cotton sheets which are not very comfortable (especially when you've gotten used to more hotels like the Westin with their "Heavenly Beds" -- good down comforters covered in high thread count cotton sheets). Nevertheless, we really enjoyed our stay at Victoria Palace and would definitely go back there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mrosado
Reviews.Content: Stayed in junior suite #702 which is the only room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and I had requested when I made the reservation with Phillipe. Couldn't be more satisfied. Room was exactly like the website picture and spotless. Staff was very nice and accomodating. Breakfast buffet was included in our rate. One egg dish, bacon and sausage with a variety of cereals, cheeses and meats, fruts. Croissants are declicious. It is pricey 22$US and if not included you would do better going to one of the cafe's. Take a right outside the hotel onto the main strip and the I think the first right is a great bakery on the left and down a little is a famous butcher with Rotisserie food prepared. Delicious augratin potatoes. If this is your first trip to Paris I recommend you take The Paris first tour to get an overall of the city. We took the Versailles tour which I thought was not worth it. The guide just dropped us off at the Palace and came back an hour later. He did though give us an overview of Versaille and we stopped at one of the historical stops in Versaille. If you are into churches see St. Sulpice church if you can its close to the hotel also the Miraculous Medal Chapel with the virgin Mary appeared to Sister Catherine Lapour in the 1834. We went on Palm Sunday. Be careful of the beggars (young females) outside of Notre Dame dressed in dirty clothing kerchiefs holding a sign in broken english stating they are from another country and their mother has just died and they need money for food. My friend and I gave her money and when I left the Cathedral I saw her and three others dressed the same way huddled together smiling putting money in a pouch. Anyway enjoy Paris I have it was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “I'm too cynical!”
Reviews.Author: Scooney1967
Reviews.Content: I must admit, when I read all the rave reviews about this hotel, I was a bit unsure. Was it the hotel owner and his 40 friends? Or was it genuine. Well, I am too cynical for my own good! This is one top top hotel. Everything the previous reviewers say is true. From the minute you walk into the hotel, you are made welcome (Marc was our receptionist at the time and he took us to our room.) We are so-called budget travellers, we arrived by Ryanair, but like to spend a bit extra on a hotel. This hotel is worth every penny. It is truly excellent value. Our room was perfect, I don't have one bad thing to say about it. The bathroom was luxurious, the room was clean, and we had 2 nights of great sleep. The staff were genuinely nice, and were never overlly nice, if you know what I mean. Breakfast was lovely, and we were treated so well. Slippers and robes in (suite) rooms, cold minibar, cool TV, strong shower, nice toiletries - all the small things that add up to make a great hotel, but so many of the bigger hotels (or even 5 star hotels) get wrong. Great views of typical Parisian Rue, in a great area for shopping (Le Wife was living her dream!) Well done Mr Owner (sorry I can't remember your name) but you have a great hotel - please don't let it change, and we will be back! (One thing I would say, the nearest Metro stop isn't St. Seplice - although I can't remember what it was called now! Think it begins with a "p". Even Montmatre was closer. I very rarely give any service 10/10, be it a shop, a restaurant, a company etc, but this hotel is 10/10. If you have a problem with this hotel, you have a problem with life. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with perfect people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights with my wife at this hotel after reviewing Tripadvisor. Every word is true. Hotel is a a goog and quit location, Close to the Metro en to the City Center. People at the helpdesk were very friendly end helpful. Room was vey nice and when we arrived there was free choclat and champagne on te room. Enough touwels and also the breakastserved on teh room was very go. I thinkwe go there more often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: kemallino
Reviews.Content: When we (me & wife) went there, we were met by very friendly staff who treated us as if we were the owners of the hotel. The reception check-in process was so quick that we thought everything were made ready prior to our arrival. Rooms are decorated so nicely. They give you the impression as if you are a king! I will definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “A triple-threat hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is small, only about 65 rooms, and a sense of intimacy pervades. My room was covered in cream, red and dutch blue figured fabric and opened through tall French doors onto a small balcony. The bathroom was completely marble with the most modern, gleaming fixtures. Breakfast demonstrated that the hotelier is a foodie, and on my breakfast tray one morning was a full blown yellow and red orchid. The hotel is situated in a tiny corner in the Cherche-du-Midi neighborhood and is very quiet and peaceful. Stay in it once and you will be sorry if you ever stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving in Paris. We almost cancelled, because of the riots and car burnings. But when we arrived at the Victoria Palace Hotel, we were so glad that we went! This beautiful hotel is on a quiet street in Montparnasse, just one block from Rue de Rennes and two blocks from Boulevard Montparnasse. It is not far from the Luxembourg Gardens, and very near to wonderful restaurants and great shopping. We walked everywhere . . . to Notre-Dame, to the Latin Quarter, to the MusÃ©e D'Orsay . . . even though it was very cold. It was so nice at the end of the day to return to our gorgeous and comfortable room at the hotel, or to sit by the fire in the lounge and have nice drink before changing for dinner. The staff was amazing, not only friendly and kind, but so knowledgeable. Their restaurant recommendations were right on, and after the first day, I completely gave up consulting the guide book about dining out. The hotel is very quiet and serene, a lovely oasis in chaotic Paris. I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this modern hotel wiht a touch of past Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last July, I had the pleasure to stay at the Victoria Palace Hotel which was both comfortable and luxurious. What a pleasure to leave the hustle and bustle of Paris and enter an elegant lobby where I was warmly greeted by a gracious staff. It set the tone for a wonderful sejour The renowned Jardin de Luxemborg is a 10 minute walk. I was pleasantly surprised to see Bartholdi's original image for the Statue of Liberty there. The shopping in the area is marvelous with the same famous French names but less crowded than on the right bank, and more attentive service. Restaurants and cafes are abundant I am currently making plans to return this summer. Joan Erwin, NYC

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Paul032
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a junior suite, lovely view of the eiffel tower from the room. breakfast very good, staff very friendly and helpful. Location quite good, 20 minutes to the Seine and plenty of restaurants / cafÃ©s close by. Room a bit pricy but hotels generally not cheap in paris anyway. Shower was a bit flat with not much power. Apart from that, it was lovely. why did I not give it 5 stars, I think it lacked something, couldn't put my finger on it but the wow this is fantastic wasn't there. Saying that there is nothing at all I could falter.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Palace Hotel for 5 nights at the start of a family European holiday (after a 24 hour flight) in September 2005. We were in a suite on the 7th floor of the hotel, which included two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a sitting room. Everything was immaculately clean and the rooms comfortably spacious. The staff were very friendly and helpful, suggesting restaurants and giving directions. Our teenage children felt welcome and loved their room. The rooms were very quiet and the hotel is in a great area of Paris - within walking distance of both the middle of Paris or various metros. One thing we enjoyed about this location was that it is not only tourists around - plenty of Parisians going about their business which was fascinating for our children. The breakfast was good and the breakfast room well decorated and comfortable, although it was expensive compared to local cafes. Thanks for a great start to our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MMuylaert
Reviews.Content: All the reviews were right. This is a wonderful place to stay. Close to the metro, quiet, and everyone was very helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Our room, a junior suite, was beautiful. The bathroom was lovely and everything was spotless. It was always a pleasure to return to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lkw101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Palace for 5 nights. We had a junior suite with an amazing view of the Eifel Tower. The room was spacious, well appointed and very clean. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendation. The large tub, bathrobes and slippers were much appreciated after a long day of walking around Paris. We did not eat at the hotel, but did enjoy coffee in our room each am prior to venturing out. The in room wi-fi (10 euros/day) worked well. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NelidaNewYork_N_Y_
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Victoria Palace for six nights and we were extremely pleased with the service and well decorated and kept rooms. The staff is so pleasant and are always willing to go the extra mile in providing service. The staff is excellent ! This is definitely a great place to stay during a vacation. They make a great cup of hot chocolate also. The hotel is within a 15 minute walk to the Luxembourg Gardens, which is beautiful. There are many great restaurants, shopping mall and close to the Metro. I would definitely stay there again. Nelida Mejia

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emtf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on Honeymoon a few weeks ago. The hotel itself is close to all the major attractions (only a short metro ride) and is in a nice quiet street close to some good high street shops. The whole experience was truly brilliant. The room was full of character and we had a decent enough view from the balcony. The staff were excellent and the place was spotless. Breakfast was fab, lots of really nice goodies laid on. And for a change the bar prices were not a total rip-off but typical hotel prices. I really cannot praise this hotel enough. We have a wonderful stay there and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary in Paris at the Victoria Palace Hotel. It was absolutely fantastic. They upgraded us to a Junior suite which was enormous by European standards. We were very impressed with the wonderful furnishing, helpful staff and lovely breakfast. However, what was really impressive were the little 'extras' like the weather forecast every night, umbrellas in case of rain, and a very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sdrawkcabekiM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Summer, 2004. We had a Junior Suite and, whilst it was fairly pricey (but then, it's Paris!), we thought it was absolutely top notch. I really liked the hotel, the staff were excellent, the room was fantastic and there's absolutely nothing I could say about this hotel that would be negative. It's a great little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: buddydogg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a trip to Paris. It couldn't have been better. The staff was helpful, and fluent in English. Rooms are spacious and the bathrooms done mostly in marble. Don't expect a great scenic view but who needs that when you are steps away from the bustling streets even though the hotel is on a very quiet one. We will return to this lovely hotel.
